q: What is the best practice for managing AWS IAM access keys?

options.A: There is no need to manage access keys.
options.B: Customers should rotate access keys regularly.
options.C: AWS rotate access keys on a schedule.
options.D: Never use access keys, always use IAM roles.

explanation: It is a security best practice to rotate access keys regularly. This practice ensures that if access keys are compromised the security exposure is mitigated.
correct: "Customers should rotate access keys regularly" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "There is no need to manage access keys" is incorrect. This is not true; you must rotate access keys.
incorrect.C: "AWS rotate access keys on a schedule" is incorrect. AWS do not rotate your access keys.
incorrect.D: "Never use access keys, always use IAM roles" is incorrect. It is often better and more secure to use IAM roles for some uses but it is certainly not the case that you should never use access keys.

q: What are AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) access keys used for?

options.A: Logging in to the AWS Management Console.
options.B: Ensuring the integrity of log files.
options.C: Making programmatic calls to AWS from AWS APIs.
options.D: Enabling encryption in transit for web servers.

explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials for an IAM user or the AWS account root user. You can use access keys to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API (directly or using the AWS SDK). Access keys consist of two parts: an access key ID and a secret access key.
correct: "Making programmatic calls to AWS from AWS APIs" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Logging in to the AWS Management Console" is incorrect. You use a user name and password for the management console.
incorrect.B: "Ensuring the integrity of log files" is incorrect. This is not what access keys are used for.
incorrect.D: "Enabling encryption in transit for web servers" is incorrect. SSL/TLS certificates are used for creating encrypted channels using HTTPS.

q: For what purpose would a Cloud Practitioner access AWS Artifact?

options.A: Download configuration details for all AWS resources.
options.B: Access training materials for AWS services.
options.C: Create a security assessment report for AWS services.
options.D: Gain access to AWS security and compliance documents.

explanation: AWS Artifact is your go-to, central resource for compliance-related information that matters to you. It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements.
correct: "Gain access to AWS security and compliance documents" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Download configuration details for all AWS resources" is incorrect. Artifact does not provide this capability.
incorrect.B: "Access training materials for AWS services" is incorrect. Artifact does not provide training materials.
incorrect.C: "Create a security assessment report for AWS services" is incorrect. Artifact cannot be used for this purpose.

q: A company is deploying an application in the AWS Cloud. How can they secure the application? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Enable encryption for the application data at rest.
options.B: Configure public access for the AWS services used by the application.
options.C: Enable monitoring by turning off encryption for data in transit.
options.D: Limit access privileges according to the principal of least privilege.
options.E: Provide full admin access to developer and operations staff.

explanation: In this scenario the company must apply best practice principals for securing their application. Enabling encryption for data at rest is definitely a good practice and data in transit should also be encrypted where possible as well. It is also a good practice to limit access privileges according to the principal of least privilege.
correct: "Enable encryption for the application data at rest" and "Limit access privileges according to the principal of least privilege" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Configure public access for the AWS services used by the application" is incorrect. In some cases public access may be required and in that case only the front end service(s) should be configured for public access.
incorrect.C: "Enable monitoring by turning off encryption for data in transit" is incorrect. There is no need to turn off encryption in transit to enable monitoring and this would reduce security.
incorrect.E: "Provide full admin access to developer and operations staff" is incorrect. This is not a security best practice; it is better to assign permissions according to the principal of least privilege.

q: Which AWS service or feature can assist with protecting a website that is hosted outside of AWS?
explanation: AWS WAF can be used to protect on-premises resources if they are deployed behind an Application Load Balancer (ALB). In this scenario the on-premises website servers are added to a target group by IP address.
correct: "AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon VPC route tables" is incorrect. A route table cannot be used for protecting resources running outside AWS.
incorrect.B: "Amazon EC2 security groups" is incorrect. Security groups can only be attached to EC2 instances.
incorrect.C: "Amazon VPC network ACLs" is incorrect. Network ACLs only filter traffic entering and leaving a VPC subnet.

q: Which AWS service can a company use to discover and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets.
explanation: Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service that uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and protect your sensitive data in AWS. Amazon Macie automates the discovery of sensitive data at scale and lowers the cost of protecting your data.
correct: "Amazon Macie" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior.
incorrect.B: "AWS Policy Generator" is incorrect. The AWS Policy Generator is a tool that enables you to create policies that control access to Amazon Web Services (AWS) products and resources.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Detective" is incorrect. Amazon Detective automatically processes terabytes of event data records about IP traffic, AWS management operations, and malicious or unauthorized activity.

q: Which tasks require the use of the AWS account root user? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Some tasks can only be performed by the root user of an AWS account. This includes changing the account name and changing AWS support plans.
correct: "Changing the account name" and "Changing AWS Support plans" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Enabling encryption for S3" is incorrect. This does not require root.
incorrect.B: "Viewing AWS CloudTrail logs" is incorrect. This does not require root.
incorrect.E: "Changing payment currency" is incorrect. This does not require root.

q: Which type of credential should a Cloud Practitioner use for programmatic access to AWS resources from the AWS CLI/API?
explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials for an IAM user or the AWS account root user. You can use access keys to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API (directly or using the AWS SDK).
correct: "Access keys" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "SSL/TLS certificate" is incorrect. Certificates are not used by users for authenticating to AWS services.
incorrect.B: "SSH public keys" is incorrect. These are used for connections using the SSH protocol.
incorrect.D: "User name and password" is incorrect. An IAM user name and password can be used for console access but cannot be used with the CLI or API.

q: A company must provide access to AWS resources for their employees. Which security practices should they follow? (Select TWO.)

options.B: Create IAM policies based on least privilege principles.
options.C: Disable password policies and management console access.
options.D: Create IAM users in different AWS Regions.
options.E: Create IAM Roles and apply them to IAM groups.

explanation: Enabling multi-factor authentication is a best practice to require a second factor of authentication when logging in. Another best practice is to grant least privilege access when configuring users and password policies.
correct: "Enable multi-factor authentication for users" and "Create IAM policies based on least privilege principles" are the correct answers.

incorrect.C: "Disable password policies and management console access" is incorrect. This is not a security best practice.
incorrect.D: "Create IAM users in different AWS Regions" is incorrect. You cannot create IAM users in different Regions as the IAM service is a global service.
incorrect.E: "Create IAM Roles and apply them to IAM groups" is incorrect. You cannot apply roles to groups, you apply policies to groups.

q: An individual IAM user must be granted access to an Amazon S3 bucket using a bucket policy. Which element in the S3 bucket policy should be updated to define the user account for which access will be granted?
explanation: The Principal element specifies the user, account, service, or other entity that is allowed or denied access to a resource.
correct: "Principal" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Action" is incorrect. Actions are the permissions that you can specify in a policy.
incorrect.C: "Resource" is incorrect. Resources are the ARNs of resources you wish to specify permissions for.
incorrect.D: "Condition" is incorrect. Conditions define certain conditions to apply when granting permissions such as the source IP address of the caller.

q: A new e-commerce company is looking for an AWS service to send transactional emails, such as order confirmations and password resets, to their customers. Which AWS service would be most appropriate for this task?
explanation: Amazon SES is specifically designed to help users send transactional emails, marketing messages, and other types of content to their customers. It provides a reliable and cost-effective way for businesses to communicate with their customer base through emails.
correct: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is incorrect. While Amazon SNS can send notifications via email, it is primarily designed to send messages to a distributed set of recipients and is not optimized for transactional emails.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. Amazon SQS is a message bus service used for decoupling applications.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)" is incorrect. Amazon EC2 can host applications and services, but it does not provide specialized functionalities for sending transactional emails.

q: A corporation with multiple departments each having their own AWS accounts wants to implement a solution to customize billing data to match their specific showback or chargeback business logic. They wish to group accounts with similar financial owners and generate a distinct Cost and Usage Report (CUR) for each group. Which AWS service should they use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Billing Conductor is the correct answer because it is a customizable billing service that allows the organization to define billing groups, set pricing rules, create custom line items, and generate a unique Cost and Usage Report (CUR) for each billing group.
correct: "AWS Billing Conductor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. While it allows organizations to set custom cost and usage budgets, it does not offer the extensive customization and grouping features required.
incorrect.B: "AWS Cost Explorer" is incorrect. It helps in visualizing and managing AWS spending and usage but doesn't offer functionalities to create billing groups and set pricing rules at a granular level.
incorrect.C: "AWS Billing and Cost Management" is incorrect. It is a tool to track AWS usage and expenditures but doesn't offer specialized functionalities for creating billing groups.

q: A newly founded tech startup is looking for a program that offers AWS credits, training, technical support, and other resources to help them build their business. Which AWS program would be the best fit for them?
explanation: AWS Activate for Startups is the correct answer because this program is specially designed to provide startups with the low-cost, easy-to-use infrastructure needed to scale and grow. It offers a host of benefits including AWS credits, training, technical support, and other resources.
correct: "AWS Activate for Startups" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Educate" is incorrect because this program is primarily targeted at the educational sector.
incorrect.C: "AWS Marketplace" is incorrect because it is a digital catalog that helps customers find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software.
incorrect.D: "AWS Partner Network" is incorrect because it is aimed at helping APN Partners to build successful AWS-based businesses.

q: A small business owner who is not tech-savvy is looking to find AWS certified experts for a short-term project. They need a service that can help them connect with professionals who can offer advice and help implement AWS solutions quickly. Which AWS service should they use?
explanation: AWS IQ is the correct answer because it is designed to help customers find AWS certified third-party experts for on-demand help. Through AWS IQ, business owners can find, communicate with, and hire AWS experts quickly.
correct: "AWS IQ" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Training and Certification" is incorrect because it helps in learning and understanding AWS services but does not facilitate connecting with AWS experts for project implementation.
incorrect.C: "AWS Support" is incorrect because it doesn't offer the feature to connect directly with certified AWS experts for personalized project assistance in this manner.
incorrect.D: "AWS Marketplace" is incorrect because it mainly serves as a platform to find software and services, not connecting customers with experts for consultation.

q: Which AWS service does AWS Snowball Edge natively support?
explanation: You can run Amazon EC2 compute instances hosted on a Snowball Edge with the sbe1, sbe-c, and sbe-g instance types.
correct: "Amazon EC2" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS)" is incorrect. AWS SMS does not integrate natively with Snowball Edge.
incorrect.B: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is incorrect. AWS DMS does not integrate natively with Snowball Edge.
incorrect.C: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor does not integrate natively with Snowball Edge.

q: A cloud practitioner needs to migrate a 70 TB of data from an on-premises data center into the AWS Cloud. The company has a slow and unreliable internet connection. Which AWS service can the cloud practitioner leverage to transfer the data?
explanation: AWS Snowball is a method of transferring the data using a physical device. A Snowball Edge device can hold up to 80 TB so a single device can be used. This transfer method completely avoids the slow and unreliable internet connection.
correct: "AWS Snowball" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. Glacier is used for archiving data in the cloud.
incorrect.C: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. Storage Gateway is a service that offers options for connecting on-premises storage to the cloud.
incorrect.D: "AWS DataSync" is incorrect. DataSync uses the internet to transfer data.

q: A company has a global user base and needs to deploy AWS services that can decrease network latency for their users. Which services may assist? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that caches media assets in Edge locations around the world. AWS Global Accelerator is a service that can direct users to the nearest AWS Region that contains and endpoint for an application using Edge locations.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" and "AWS Global Accelerator" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Amazon VPC" is incorrect as this service does not decrease latency for global users.
incorrect.C: "Application Auto Scaling" is incorrect as this is used to scale applications based on workload, it does not decrease latency.
incorrect.D: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect as this service does decrease latency but not for a global user base.

q: Which AWS service is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) is a highly available, durable, secure, fully managed pub/sub messaging service that enables you to decouple microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. SNS can be used to fan out notifications to end users using mobile push, SMS, and email.
correct: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is incorrect. This service is used for sending email but not SMS text messages.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Simple Workflow Service (Amazon SWF)" is incorrect. Amazon SWF helps developers build, run, and scale background jobs.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. Amazon SQS is a fully managed message queuing service.

q: An application has highly dynamic usage patterns. Which characteristics of the AWS Cloud make it cost-effective for this type of workload? (Select TWO.)
explanation: AWS is cost-effective for dynamic workloads because it is elastic, meaning your workload can scale based on demand, and because you only pay for what you use.
correct: "Elasticity" and "Pay-as-you-go pricing" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "High availability" is incorrect. This is not a characteristic that results in cost-effectiveness.
incorrect.B: "Strict security" is incorrect. This is not a characteristic that results in cost-effectiveness.
incorrect.E: "Reliability" is incorrect. This is not a characteristic that results in cost-effectiveness.

q: Which benefits can a company immediately realize using the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Variable expenses are replaced with capital expenses
options.B: Capital expenses are replaced with variable expenses

explanation: A couple of the benefits that companies will realize immediately when using the AWS Cloud are increased agility and a change from capital expenditure to variable operational expenditure.
correct: "Capital expenses are replaced with variable expenses" and "Increased agility" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Variable expenses are replaced with capital expenses" is incorrect. This is the wrong way around.
incorrect.C: "User control of physical infrastructure" is incorrect. You do not get control of the physical infrastructure.
incorrect.E: "No responsibility for security" is incorrect. You are still responsible for "security in the cloud".

q: Amazon DynamoDB is used by a business in its AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following is a duty of the organization, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Select two.)

options.B: Application of appropriate permissions with IAM tools

explanation: Cloud security at AWS is the highest priority. Security is a shared responsibility between AWS and the AWS customer. Customers are responsible for managing their data (including encryption options), classifying their assets, and using IAM tools to apply the appropriate permissions.
correct: "Application of appropriate permissions with IAM tools" and "Configuration of data encryption options" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Operating system patching and upgrades" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility for managed services like DynamoDB.
incorrect.D: "Creation of DynamoDB endpoints" is incorrect. While customers use endpoints, the infrastructure maintenance is AWS's responsibility.
incorrect.E: "Infrastructure provisioning and maintenance" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.

q: A company wants to launch its workload on AWS and requires the system to automatically recover from failure. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework includes this requirement?
explanation: The reliability pillar includes the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions, dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand, and mitigate disruptions such as misconfigurations or transient network issues.
correct: "Reliability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Cost optimization" is incorrect. This pillar focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs.
incorrect.B: "Operational excellence" is incorrect. This pillar focuses on running and monitoring systems to deliver business value.
incorrect.C: "Performance efficiency" is incorrect. This pillar focuses on using IT and computing resources efficiently.

q: Which AWS service should a company use to create a NoSQL database?
explanation: AWS DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that is designed to provide fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. It is a good choice for companies looking to create a NoSQL database in AWS.
correct: "Amazon DynamoDB" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Aurora" is incorrect. Aurora is a relational database service.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect. Redshift is a data warehousing service.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Neptune" is incorrect. Neptune is a graph database service.

q: Which AWS service or functionality is utilized by distributed applications to send text and email messages?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) is a fully managed messaging service for both application-to-application (A2A) and application-to-person (A2P) communication. The A2P functionality enables you to send messages to users at scale via SMS, mobile push, and email.
correct: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is incorrect. SES is primarily for email, not SMS/text.
incorrect.C: "Amazon CloudWatch alerts" is incorrect. CloudWatch monitors resources but uses SNS to send the actual notifications.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. SQS is a message queuing service for decoupling components, not primarily for sending texts/emails to users.

q: To achieve high availability, how many Availability Zones should computing resources be provided across?

options.D: A minimum of four or more

explanation: High availability requires at least two availability zones. The idea is that only one zone will go down at a time (e.g., a power outage). Since Amazon isolates the data centers for each availability zone, an issue in one likely wonâ€™t affect the other.
correct: "A minimum of two" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "A minimum of one" is incorrect. A single AZ represents a single point of failure for availability.
incorrect.C: "A minimum of three" is incorrect. While better, the *minimum* required for high availability is two.
incorrect.D: "A minimum of four or more" is incorrect. The minimum requirement is two.

q: Which of the following is AWS's obligation under the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.C: Operating system patching on Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the hardware and software that run AWS services. This includes maintaining the physical infrastructure, such as updating firmware on hardware components.
correct: "Firmware updates on hardware" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Data encryption in transit" is incorrect. This is a customer responsibility (Security in the Cloud).
incorrect.C: "Operating system patching on Amazon EC2 instances" is incorrect. This is a customer responsibility (Security in the Cloud).
incorrect.D: "Data encryption at rest" is incorrect. This is a customer responsibility (Security in the Cloud).

q: To boost availability, a user intends to create two more Amazon EC2 instances. What should the user do?

options.A: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
options.B: Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone.
options.C: Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions, but in the same Availability Zone.
options.D: Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances in the same AWS Region, but in different Availability Zones.

explanation: Launching instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region protects against the failure of a single location/zone, boosting availability. Although rare, failures can occur that affect the availability of instances in the same location.
correct: "Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone" is incorrect. This does not improve availability if that single zone fails.
incorrect.C: "Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions, but in the same Availability Zone" is incorrect. Availability Zones are specific to a Region; you cannot have the 'same' AZ across different Regions.
incorrect.D: "Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances..." is incorrect. While spreading across AZs helps, Spot Instances can be interrupted by AWS, which might reduce availability compared to On-Demand or Reserved.

q: What are the customer's duties under the AWS shared responsibility model? (Select two.)
explanation: Customers are responsible for the security of everything they put in the AWS Cloud. This includes content control, data encryption (in transit and at rest), and data integrity.
correct: "Security of data in transit" and "Data integrity authentication" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Physical and environmental security" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility (Security of the Cloud).
incorrect.B: "Physical network devices including firewalls" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Storage device decommissioning" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.

q: A large enterprise with multiple VPCs in several AWS Regions around the world needs to connect and centrally manage network connectivity between its VPCs. Which AWS service or feature meets these requirements?
explanation: AWS Transit Gateway connects your Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) and on-premises networks through a central hub. This connection simplifies your network and puts an end to complex peering relationships.
correct: "AWS Transit Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Direct Connect creates a dedicated link to on-premises networks but isn't the primary tool for interconnecting multiple global VPCs centrally.
incorrect.C: "AWS Site-to-Site VPN" is incorrect. While VPNs connect networks, managing them mesh-style for many VPCs is complex; Transit Gateway is designed for this centralization.
incorrect.D: "VPC endpoints" is incorrect. VPC endpoints allow private connections to AWS services, not primarily for interconnecting user VPCs globally.

q: Which AWS service should be used to monitor Amazon EC2 instances for CPU and network utilization?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service for AWS cloud resources and the applications you run on AWS. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to collect and track metrics, collect and monitor log files, and set alarms.
correct: "Amazon CloudWatch" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Inspector is for security assessments.
incorrect.B: "AWS CloudTrail" is incorrect. CloudTrail logs API calls.
incorrect.D: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Config tracks resource configuration changes.

q: How can customers minimize the amount of time they spend patching their operating systems by migrating to the AWS Cloud? (Select two.)

options.A: Users can take advantage of managed services on AWS.
options.B: Users can outsource operating system patching to the AWS Support team.
options.C: AWS Professional Services will upgrade instances to the latest operating system versions.
options.D: Users have the ability to use license-included Amazon EC2 instances.
options.E: Users can take advantage of AWS Systems Manager features.

explanation: Using managed services (like RDS) offloads patching to AWS. AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager automates the process of patching managed nodes with both security-related updates and other types of updates.
correct: "Users can take advantage of managed services on AWS" and "Users can take advantage of AWS Systems Manager features" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Users can outsource operating system patching to the AWS Support team" is incorrect. Support does not perform operations/patching for you.
incorrect.C: "AWS Professional Services will upgrade instances..." is incorrect. Professional Services is a consulting arm, not an automated patching solution.
incorrect.D: "Users have the ability to use license-included Amazon EC2 instances" is incorrect. License-included just means you don't bring your own license; it doesn't automatically handle patching.

q: In the case of an environmental disruption, a company needs to make sure its infrastructure is structured for fault tolerance and business continuity. Which parts of the AWS architecture should the organization replicate?
explanation: Replicating across AWS Regions provides the highest level of fault tolerance and business continuity in the event of a widespread environmental disruption that might affect a specific geographic area (which contains the AZs).
correct: "Regions" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Edge locations" is incorrect. These are for caching content, not primary infrastructure replication.
incorrect.B: "Availability Zones" is incorrect. While AZs handle local failures, a large environmental disruption could impact multiple AZs in one Region.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Route 53" is incorrect. Route 53 is a DNS service, not an infrastructure component to replicate *per se* (though it helps route traffic).

q: According to which AWS cloud design guideline, systems should minimize their interdependence?
explanation: Loose coupling allows for the reduction of interdependencies, meaning a change or failure in one component does not cascade to other components. This is a key design principle.
correct: "Loose coupling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Scalability" is incorrect. This refers to handling increased load.
incorrect.B: "Services, not servers" is incorrect. This refers to using managed services.
incorrect.C: "Removing single points of failure" is incorrect. While related to reliability, it doesn't specifically define minimizing interdependence like loose coupling does.

q: Which tasks need the root user credentials for an AWS account? (Select two.)

options.A: Creating an Amazon EC2 key pair
options.B: Removing an IAM user from the administrators group
options.D: Creating an Amazon CloudFront key pair
options.E: Granting an IAM user full administrative access

explanation: Tasks requiring the root user include changing the AWS Support plan and closing the AWS account. Note: While granting admin access (E) is listed as a correct answer in the source material, typically creating CloudFront key pairs (D) is also a root task. However, based on the source provided, changing support plans and restoring IAM permissions (often interpreted as granting access when locked out) are highlighted.
correct: "Changing the AWS Support plan" and "Granting an IAM user full administrative access" (specifically restoring permissions) are the correct answers based on the source context.

incorrect.A: "Creating an Amazon EC2 key pair" is incorrect. Regular IAM users can do this.
incorrect.B: "Removing an IAM user from the administrators group" is incorrect. Admins can do this.
incorrect.D: "Creating an Amazon CloudFront key pair" is incorrect. (Note: Historically root was required for CloudFront key pairs for trusted signers, but the provided source material points to C and E as the intended answers).

q: A user wants to deploy a service to the AWS Cloud by using infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles. Which AWS service can be used to meet this requirement?
explanation: AWS CloudFormation provides a common language for you to model and provision AWS and third party application resources in your cloud environment. It allows you to treat infrastructure as code.
correct: "AWS CloudFormation" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Systems Manager" is incorrect. This is for operational management.
incorrect.C: "AWS CodeCommit" is incorrect. This is for source control (git), not the deployment engine itself.
incorrect.D: "AWS Config" is incorrect. This is for auditing configuration compliance.

q: A company that has multiple business units wants to centrally manage and govern its AWS Cloud environments. The company wants to automate the creation of AWS accounts, apply service control policies (SCPs), and simplify billing processes. Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Organizations provides the capability to centrally manage and govern cloud environments. It allows for account automation, consolidated billing, and applying Service Control Policies (SCPs) across the organization.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Cost Explorer" is incorrect. It is for cost analysis, not account governance.
incorrect.C: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. It is for setting cost thresholds.
incorrect.D: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. It provides optimization recommendations.

q: An administrator must fast install and begin utilizing a popular IT product. What resources are available to the administrator?
explanation: AWS Quick Starts (now often referred to as Partner Solutions) are automated reference deployments built by AWS solutions architects and partners to help you deploy popular technologies on AWS quickly.
correct: "AWS Quick Start reference deployments" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Well-Architected Framework documentation" is incorrect. This provides best practices, not automated deployments.
incorrect.B: "Amazon CloudFront" is incorrect. This is a CDN service.
incorrect.C: "AWS CodeCommit" is incorrect. This is a source control service.

q: Which solution enables users in various AWS Regions to have the FASTEST application response times for frequently requested data?

options.A: AWS CloudTrail across multiple Availability Zones
options.D: A virtual private gateway over AWS Direct Connect

explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a global content delivery network (CDN) service that accelerates delivery of your websites, APIs, video content, or other web assets through CDN caching at edge locations.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront to edge locations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudTrail..." is incorrect. CloudTrail is for auditing logs, not content delivery.
incorrect.C: "AWS CloudFormation..." is incorrect. CloudFormation is for infrastructure provisioning.
incorrect.D: "A virtual private gateway..." is incorrect. This is for VPN connections.

q: Which qualities make AWS Cloud computing advantageous? (Select two.)

options.A: A 100% service level agreement (SLA) for all AWS services
options.B: Compute capacity that is adjusted on demand
options.C: Availability of AWS Support for code development

explanation: AWS allows you to adjust compute capacity on demand (elasticity) and provides enhanced security through its shared responsibility model and diverse security services. Note: AWS does not offer a 100% SLA for all services.
correct: "Compute capacity that is adjusted on demand" and "Enhanced security" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "A 100% service level agreement (SLA)..." is incorrect. SLAs are typically 99.9% to 99.99%, never 100%.
incorrect.C: "Availability of AWS Support for code development" is incorrect. AWS Support helps with operational health, not writing application code.
incorrect.E: "Increases in cost and complexity" is incorrect. The goal is to decrease these.

q: A corporation anticipates a brief increase in internet traffic for their application. The program cannot be interrupted during the traffic spike. In addition, the organization must reduce costs while increasing flexibility. To achieve these needs, which Amazon EC2 instance type should the organization use?
explanation: On-Demand Instances are best for short-term, irregular workloads that cannot be interrupted. They require no upfront payment or long-term commitment.
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Spot instances can be interrupted by AWS, which violates the requirement.
incorrect.C: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. These require a long-term commitment (1 or 3 years), which is not suitable for a brief increase.
incorrect.D: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. These are for licensing compliance and are generally more expensive.

q: Which option is an environment that consists of one or more data centers?
explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region.
correct: "Availability Zone" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon CloudFront" is incorrect. CloudFront is a CDN service.
incorrect.C: "VPC" is incorrect. A VPC is a virtual network.
incorrect.D: "AWS Outposts" is incorrect. Outposts is a hybrid cloud service.

q: A company is moving an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud. The company must migrate 50 petabytes of file storage data to AWS with the least possible operational overhead. Which AWS service or resource should the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Snowmobile is an Exabyte-scale data transfer service used to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS. You can transfer up to 100PB per Snowmobile.
correct: "AWS Snowmobile" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Snowball Edge" is incorrect. Snowball Edge devices hold up to 80TB. You would need hundreds of them for 50PB.
incorrect.C: "AWS Data Exchange" is incorrect. This is for finding and subscribing to third-party data.
incorrect.D: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is incorrect. DMS is for database migrations, not massive file storage migrations.

q: A company has an application with robust hardware requirements. The application must be accessed by students who are using lightweight, low-cost laptops. Which AWS service will help the company deploy the application without investing in backend infrastructure or high-end client hardware?
explanation: AppStream 2.0 lets you move your desktop applications to AWS without rewriting them. It streams the application to users, so the heavy processing happens on AWS, not the user's device.
correct: "Amazon AppStream 2.0" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS AppSync" is incorrect. AppSync is for building data-driven mobile and web apps.
incorrect.C: "Amazon WorkLink" is incorrect. WorkLink provides secure access to internal websites and apps.
incorrect.D: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk" is incorrect. Beanstalk is for deploying web applications, not streaming desktop apps.

q: A company wants to query its server logs to gain insights about its customersâ€™ experiences. Which AWS service will store this data MOST cost-effectively?
explanation: Amazon S3 is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance at a very low cost, making it ideal for storing logs.
correct: "Amazon S3" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Aurora" is incorrect. Aurora is a relational database and would be more expensive for storing logs.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. EFS is file storage and typically more expensive than S3.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. EBS is block storage for EC2 and is more expensive than S3 for this use case.

q: Which of the following is a recommended design principle for AWS Cloud architecture?

options.B: Build a single application component that can handle all the application functionality.
options.C: Make large changes on fewer iterations to reduce chances of failure.
options.D: Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.

explanation: Avoiding monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads (microservices) allows for independent scaling, fault isolation, and agility. This aligns with the principle of loose coupling.
correct: "Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Design tightly coupled components" is incorrect. You should design *loosely* coupled components.
incorrect.B: "Build a single application component..." is incorrect. This describes a monolithic architecture.
incorrect.C: "Make large changes on fewer iterations..." is incorrect. You should make small, frequent, reversible changes.

q: Which AWS service helps users audit API activity across their AWS account?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail tracks user activity and API usage. It logs API calls, who made them, when, and from where.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Inspector is for security assessments.
incorrect.C: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. WAF is a web application firewall.
incorrect.D: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Config tracks resource configuration changes.

q: Which task is a customerâ€™s responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Management of the guest operating systems
options.B: Maintenance of the configuration of infrastructure devices
options.C: Management of the host operating systems and virtualization
options.D: Maintenance of the software that powers Availability Zones

explanation: Customers are responsible for managing the guest operating system (including updates and security patches) and other associated application software.
correct: "Management of the guest operating systems" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Maintenance of the configuration of infrastructure devices" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Management of the host operating systems and virtualization" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Maintenance of the software that powers Availability Zones" is incorrect. This is an AWS responsibility.

q: A company wants to automatically add and remove Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants the EC2 instances to adjust to varying workloads dynamically. Which service or feature will meet these requirements?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling helps you maintain application availability and allows you to automatically add or remove EC2 instances according to conditions you define.
correct: "Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. DynamoDB is a database service.
incorrect.B: "Amazon EC2 Spot Instances" is incorrect. Spot instances are a purchasing option, not a scaling service.
incorrect.C: "AWS Snow Family" is incorrect. This is for data transfer.

q: A user wants to securely automate the management and rotation of credentials that are shared between applications, while spending the least amount of time on managing tasks. Which AWS service or feature can be used to accomplish this?
explanation: AWS Secrets Manager helps you protect secrets needed to access your applications, services, and IT resources. It enables you to easily rotate, manage, and retrieve database credentials, API keys, and other secrets.
correct: "AWS Secrets Manager" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudHSM" is incorrect. CloudHSM is for managing hardware security modules.
incorrect.B: "AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)" is incorrect. KMS manages encryption keys, but Secrets Manager is specifically designed for credential/secret rotation.
incorrect.D: "Server-side encryption" is incorrect. This is a feature for encrypting data at rest.

q: Which security service automatically recognizes and classifies sensitive data or intellectual property on AWS?
explanation: Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service that uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and protect your sensitive data in AWS.
correct: "Amazon Macie" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. GuardDuty is for threat detection.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Inspector is for vulnerability assessment.
incorrect.D: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. Shield is for DDoS protection.

q: Which actions are best practices for an AWS account root user? (Choose two.)

options.A: Share root user credentials with team members.
options.B: Create multiple root users for the account, separated by environment.
options.C: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) on the root user.
options.D: Create an IAM user with administrator privileges for daily administrative tasks, instead of using the root user.
options.E: Use programmatic access instead of the root user and password.

explanation: Best practices include enabling MFA on the root user and locking away the root credentials. You should create an IAM user with admin privileges for daily tasks and avoid using the root user.
correct: "Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) on the root user" and "Create an IAM user with administrator privileges for daily administrative tasks, instead of using the root user" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Share root user credentials with team members" is incorrect. Never share root credentials.
incorrect.B: "Create multiple root users..." is incorrect. You cannot create multiple root users for a single account.
incorrect.E: "Use programmatic access instead of the root user and password" is incorrect. You should generally avoid creating access keys for the root user.

q: A company is running a critical workload on an Amazon RDS DB instance. The company needs the DB instance to be highly available with a recovery time of less than 5 minutes. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Create a read replica of the DB instance.
options.B: Create a template of the DB instance by using AWS CloudFormation.
options.C: Take frequent snapshots of the DB instance. Store the snapshots in Amazon S3.
options.D: Modify the DB instance to be a Multi-AZ deployment.

explanation: Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployments provide enhanced availability and durability. In the event of a planned or unplanned outage of your DB instance, Amazon RDS automatically fails over to a standby replica in another Availability Zone.
correct: "Modify the DB instance to be a Multi-AZ deployment" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Create a read replica..." is incorrect. Read replicas are primarily for read scalability, though they can be promoted. Multi-AZ is the specific HA feature.
incorrect.B: "Create a template..." is incorrect. This helps with deployment, not HA/failover.
incorrect.C: "Take frequent snapshots..." is incorrect. Restoring from a snapshot takes time and doesn't meet the <5 min requirement as effectively as Multi-AZ failover.

q: A company plans to migrate its application to AWS and run the application on Amazon EC2 instances. The application will have continuous usage for 1 year. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount (up to 72%) compared to On-Demand pricing and provide a capacity reservation. This is ideal for steady-state usage.
correct: "Reserved Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Spot instances can be interrupted.
incorrect.C: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. This is the most expensive option for long-term continuous usage.
incorrect.D: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. This is for licensing compliance and isolation, usually more expensive.

q: A company needs to transfer data between an Amazon S3 bucket and an on-premises application. Who is responsible for the security of this data, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, the customer (the company) is responsible for "security in the cloud," which includes protecting data in transit and at rest, and managing access controls.
correct: "The company" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS" is incorrect. AWS secures the infrastructure ("security of the cloud"), but the customer must secure their data transfer.

q: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework refers to the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?
explanation: The Reliability pillar includes the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when itâ€™s expected to. This includes recovery from failure and dynamic acquisition of resources.
correct: "Reliability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security" is incorrect. This focuses on protecting information and systems.
incorrect.C: "Performance efficiency" is incorrect. This focuses on efficient use of computing resources.
incorrect.D: "Cost optimization" is incorrect. This focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs.

q: A company wants to identify Amazon S3 buckets that are shared with another AWS account. Which AWS service or feature will meet these requirements?
explanation: IAM Access Analyzer helps you identify the resources in your organization and accounts, such as Amazon S3 buckets or IAM roles, shared with an external entity.
correct: "IAM Access Analyzer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Lake Formation" is incorrect. This is for setting up data lakes.
incorrect.B: "IAM credential report" is incorrect. This reports on user credentials, not resource sharing.
incorrect.C: "Amazon CloudWatch" is incorrect. This is for monitoring and observability.

q: Which AWS service gives users the ability to build interactive business intelligence dashboards that include machine learning insights?
explanation: Amazon QuickSight is a scalable, serverless, embeddable, machine learning-powered business intelligence (BI) service built for the cloud.
correct: "Amazon QuickSight" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Athena" is incorrect. Athena is for querying S3 data using SQL.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Kendra" is incorrect. Kendra is an enterprise search service.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect. Redshift is a data warehouse service.

q: Which of the following is an AWS value proposition that describes a userâ€™s ability to scale infrastructure based on demand?
explanation: Resource elasticity refers to the ability of a system or application to automatically scale resources up or down based on demand.
correct: "Resource elasticity" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Speed of innovation" is incorrect.

q: Which action is a security best practice for access to sensitive data that is stored in an Amazon S3 bucket?

options.A: Enable S3 Cross-Region Replication (CRR) on the S3 bucket.
options.B: Use IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket.
options.C: Configure AWS WAF to prevent unauthorized access to the S3 bucket.
options.D: Configure Amazon GuardDuty to prevent unauthorized access to the S3 bucket.

explanation: Using IAM roles provides temporary security credentials and avoids hardcoding long-term credentials in applications, which is a key security best practice.
correct: "Use IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Enable S3 Cross-Region Replication (CRR)..." is incorrect. This is for redundancy, not primarily for access control security.
incorrect.C: "Configure AWS WAF..." is incorrect. WAF protects web applications, not S3 buckets directly (unless via CloudFront).
incorrect.D: "Configure Amazon GuardDuty..." is incorrect. GuardDuty detects threats but does not prevent unauthorized access proactively.

q: A company wants to know more about the benefits offered by cloud computing. The company wants to understand the operational advantage of agility. How does AWS provide agility for users?

options.A: The ability the ensure high availability by deploying workloads to multiple regions
options.B: A pay-as-you-go model for many services and resources
options.C: The ability to transfer infrastructure management to the AWS Cloud
options.D: The ability to provision and deprovision resources quickly with minimal effort

explanation: Agility in the cloud refers to the speed at which you can develop, test, and launch applications. AWS allows you to quickly spin up resources as you need them, reducing the time to market.
correct: "The ability to provision and deprovision resources quickly with minimal effort" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "The ability the ensure high availability..." is incorrect. This refers to reliability/availability.
incorrect.B: "A pay-as-you-go model..." is incorrect. This refers to cost savings/flexibility.
incorrect.C: "The ability to transfer infrastructure management..." is incorrect. This refers to managed services/undifferentiated heavy lifting.

q: A company needs a central user portal so that users can log in to third-party business applications that support Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) 2.0. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?

options.C: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)

explanation: AWS IAM Identity Center (formerly AWS Single Sign-On) is where you create, or connect, your workforce identities in AWS once and manage access centrally across your AWS organization. It supports SAML 2.0 for third-party applications.
correct: "AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)" is incorrect. IAM is for AWS resource access, not a central portal for 3rd party apps via SAML.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Cognito" is incorrect. Cognito is primarily for customer-facing app authentication (CIAM), not workforce SSO for business apps.
incorrect.D: "AWS CLI" is incorrect. This is a command line tool.

q: Which AWS service should users use to learn about AWS service availability and operations?
explanation: The AWS Health Dashboard provides alerts and remediation guidance when AWS is experiencing events that may impact you. It shows the general status of AWS services and personalized events.
correct: "AWS Health Dashboard" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EventBridge" is incorrect. This is a serverless event bus.
incorrect.B: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect. This allows organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services.
incorrect.C: "AWS Control Tower" is incorrect. This provides the easiest way to set up and govern a secure, multi-account AWS environment.

q: Which AWS service or tool can be used to capture information about inbound and outbound traffic in an Amazon VPC?
explanation: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC.
correct: "VPC Flow Logs" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Inspector is for security assessments.
incorrect.C: "VPC endpoint services" is incorrect. This enables you to create your own application and offer it to other AWS accounts.
incorrect.D: "NAT gateway" is incorrect. This allows instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet.

q: What is the customer ALWAYS responsible for managing, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Customers are responsible for managing their data (including encryption options), classifying their assets, and using IAM tools to apply the appropriate permissions.
correct: "Customer data" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Software licenses" is incorrect. While customers manage their own licenses, AWS manages licenses for some managed services.
incorrect.B: "Networking" is incorrect. AWS manages the physical networking; customers manage virtual networking configuration.
incorrect.D: "Encryption keys" is incorrect. While customers manage their keys, AWS manages the underlying key management infrastructure.

q: Which AWS service can be used to retrieve compliance reports on demand?
explanation: AWS Artifact is your go-to, central resource for compliance-related information. It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect. This helps you protect secrets needed to access your applications.
incorrect.C: "AWS Security Hub" is incorrect. This gives you a comprehensive view of your security alerts and security posture.
incorrect.D: "AWS Certificate Manager" is incorrect. This is a service that lets you easily provision, manage, and deploy SSL/TLS certificates.

q: Which AWS service enables users to check for vulnerabilities on Amazon EC2 instances by using predefined assessment templates?
explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS. It uses rules packages (templates) to check for vulnerabilities.
correct: "Amazon Inspector" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. WAF is a web application firewall.
incorrect.B: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor provides best practice recommendations but doesn't perform deep vulnerability scans on instances like Inspector.
incorrect.D: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. Shield is for DDoS protection.

q: A company plans to migrate to the AWS Cloud. The company is gathering information about its on-premises infrastructure and requires information such as the hostname, IP address, and MAC address. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Application Discovery Service helps enterprise customers plan migration projects by gathering information about their on-premises data centers.
correct: "AWS Application Discovery Service" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS DataSync" is incorrect. This is for data transfer.
incorrect.B: "AWS Application Migration Service" is incorrect. This is for the actual migration (lift and shift).
incorrect.D: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is incorrect. This is for database migration.

q: Which action will help increase security in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Enable programmatic access for all IAM users.
options.B: Use IAM users instead of IAM roles to delegate permissions.
options.C: Rotate access keys on a reoccurring basis.
options.D: Use inline policies instead of customer managed policies.

explanation: Regularly rotating long-term credentials helps you familiarize yourself with the process and limits the window of opportunity for a compromised key to be used.
correct: "Rotate access keys on a reoccurring basis" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Enable programmatic access for all IAM users" is incorrect. Only enable access for users who need it.
incorrect.B: "Use IAM users instead of IAM roles..." is incorrect. Roles are preferred for delegation as they provide temporary credentials.
incorrect.D: "Use inline policies..." is incorrect. Managed policies are generally preferred for reusability and easier management.

q: A company is planning to migrate its application to the AWS Cloud. Which AWS tool or set of resources should the company use to analyze and assess its readiness for migration?
explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) helps organizations develop an efficient and effective plan for their cloud adoption journey.
correct: "AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Pricing Calculator" is incorrect. This is for cost estimation.
incorrect.C: "AWS Well-Architected Framework" is incorrect. This is for architectural best practices, not migration readiness assessment.
incorrect.D: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. This is for cost tracking.

q: Which of the following describes some of the core functionality of Amazon S3?

options.A: Amazon S3 is a high-performance block storage service that is designed for use with Amazon EC2.
options.B: Amazon S3 is an object storage service that provides high-level performance, security, scalability, and data availability.
options.C: Amazon S3 is a fully managed, highly reliable, and scalable file storage system that is accessible over the industry-standard SMB protocol.
options.D: Amazon S3 is a scalable, fully managed elastic NFS for use with AWS Cloud services and on premises resources.

explanation: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance.
correct: "Amazon S3 is an object storage service that provides high-level performance, security, scalability, and data availability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 is a high-performance block storage service..." is incorrect. This describes Amazon EBS.
incorrect.C: "Amazon S3 is a fully managed... SMB protocol" is incorrect. This describes Amazon FSx for Windows File Server.
incorrect.D: "Amazon S3 is a scalable... elastic NFS..." is incorrect. This describes Amazon EFS.

q: Which AWS benefit is demonstrated by on-demand technology services that enable companies to replace upfront fixed expenses with variable expenses?
explanation: Pay-as-you-go pricing allows you to pay only for the resources you use, replacing the need for large upfront capital expenditures (CapEx) with variable operational expenditures (OpEx).
correct: "Pay-as-you-go pricing" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "High availability" is incorrect. This refers to uptime.
incorrect.B: "Economies of scale" is incorrect. This refers to lower costs due to aggregation.
incorrect.D: "Global reach" is incorrect. This refers to deploying applications worldwide.

q: A company is planning to run a global marketing application in the AWS Cloud. The application will feature videos that can be viewed by users. The company must ensure that all users can view these videos with low latency. Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a global content delivery network (CDN) that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency and high transfer speeds.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Auto Scaling" is incorrect. This scales compute capacity.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Kinesis Video Streams" is incorrect. This enables you to stream video from connected devices to AWS for analytics/processing.
incorrect.C: "Elastic Load Balancing" is incorrect. This distributes traffic to targets, but doesn't cache content globally for low latency like a CDN.

q: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework refers to the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?
explanation: The Reliability pillar includes the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when itâ€™s expected to. This includes recovery from failure and dynamic acquisition of resources.
correct: "Reliability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security" is incorrect. This focuses on protecting information and systems.
incorrect.C: "Performance efficiency" is incorrect. This focuses on using IT and computing resources efficiently.
incorrect.D: "Cost optimization" is incorrect. This focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs.

q: Which of the following are benefits of migrating to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
explanation: Operational resilience refers to the robustness and ability to recover from failures. Business agility refers to the speed at which you can develop and deploy applications.
correct: "Operational resilience" and "Business agility" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Discounts for products on Amazon.com" is incorrect. AWS usage doesn't give retail discounts.
incorrect.D: "Business excellence" is incorrect. While a goal, it's not a specific termed benefit like agility or resilience.
incorrect.E: "Increased staff retention" is incorrect. This is not a direct benefit of the cloud itself.

q: A company is planning to replace its physical on-premises compute servers with AWS serverless compute services. The company wants to be able to take advantage of advanced technologies quickly after the migration. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this plan represent?
explanation: The Performance Efficiency pillar includes the ability to use computing resources efficiently to meet system requirements and to maintain that efficiency as demand changes and technologies evolve. Using serverless allows you to focus on code rather than infrastructure, leveraging advanced tech.
correct: "Performance efficiency" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security" is incorrect. This focuses on protecting information.
incorrect.C: "Operational excellence" is incorrect. This focuses on running and monitoring systems.
incorrect.D: "Reliability" is incorrect. This focuses on recovery and availability.

q: Which component of the AWS global infrastructure is made up of one or more discrete data centers that have redundant power, networking, and connectivity?
explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region.
correct: "Availability Zone" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Region" is incorrect. A Region contains multiple Availability Zones.
incorrect.C: "Edge location" is incorrect. These are for content delivery.
incorrect.D: "AWS Outposts" is incorrect. This is for on-premises infrastructure.

q: Which duties are the responsibility of a company that is using AWS Lambda? (Choose two.)
explanation: With AWS Lambda, AWS manages the underlying infrastructure (servers, OS patching, CPU selection). The customer is responsible for their code, including its logic and security.
correct: "Security inside of code" and "Writing and updating of code" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Selection of CPU resources" is incorrect. You select memory, and CPU is allocated proportionally.
incorrect.C: "Patching of operating system" is incorrect. AWS handles this for Lambda.
incorrect.E: "Security of underlying infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS handles this.

q: Which AWS services or features provide disaster recovery solutions for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)

options.C: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots

explanation: AMIs allow you to launch new instances with the same configuration. EBS snapshots allow you to back up the data on your volumes. Together they enable disaster recovery.
correct: "EC2 Amazon Machine Images (AMIs)" and "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. This is a billing discount.
incorrect.D: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. This is for DDoS protection.
incorrect.E: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. This is for threat detection.

q: A company wants to review its monthly costs of using Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS for the past year. Which AWS service or tool provides this information?
explanation: AWS Cost Explorer has an easy-to-use interface that lets you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time.
correct: "Cost Explorer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor provides recommendations, not detailed historical cost analysis.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Forecast" is incorrect. Forecast is a time-series forecasting service.
incorrect.D: "Amazon CloudWatch" is incorrect. CloudWatch monitors performance metrics.

q: A company wants to migrate a critical application to AWS. The application has a short runtime. The application is invoked by changes in data or by shifts in system state. The company needs a compute solution that maximizes operational efficiency and minimizes the cost of running the application. Which AWS solution should the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying compute resources. You pay only for the compute time you consume.
correct: "AWS Lambda" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2 On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. You pay for running instances regardless of whether code is executing.
incorrect.C: "Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances" is incorrect. This implies a long-term commitment.
incorrect.D: "Amazon EC2 Spot Instances" is incorrect. While cheap, they can be interrupted and require management.

q: Which AWS service or feature allows users to connect with and deploy AWS services programmatically?
explanation: AWS software development kits (SDKs) allow users to connect with and deploy AWS services programmatically. AWS provides SDKs for several popular programming languages, including Java, Python, JavaScript, and C++.
correct: "AWS software development kits (SDKs)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Management Console" is incorrect. It is a web-based interface.
incorrect.B: "AWS Cloud9" is incorrect. It is a cloud-based IDE.
incorrect.C: "AWS CodePipeline" is incorrect. It is a continuous delivery service.

q: A company plans to create a data lake that uses Amazon S3. Which factor will have the MOST effect on cost?

options.A: The selection of S3 storage tiers
options.B: Charges to transfer existing data into Amazon S3
options.C: The addition of S3 bucket policies
options.D: S3 ingest fees for each request

explanation: Which storage tier they pick out of all the options can largely effect the final cost. Different storage classes (Standard, Intelligent-Tiering, Glacier, etc.) have significantly different pricing models for storage and retrieval.
correct: "The selection of S3 storage tiers" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Charges to transfer existing data into Amazon S3" is incorrect. Data transfer into S3 is generally free.
incorrect.C: "The addition of S3 bucket policies" is incorrect. There is no charge for bucket policies.
incorrect.D: "S3 ingest fees for each request" is incorrect. While requests have costs, the ongoing storage tier selection usually has the largest impact on long-term cost for a data lake.

q: A company is launching an ecommerce application that must always be available. The application will run on Amazon EC2 instances continuously for the next 12 months. What is the MOST cost-effective instance purchasing option that meets these requirements?
explanation: Savings Plans enable you to reduce your compute costs by committing to a consistent amount of compute usage for a 1-year or 3-year term. This results in savings of up to 72% over On-Demand Instance costs.
correct: "Savings Plans" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Spot instances can be interrupted and are not suitable for 'always available' requirements.
incorrect.C: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. This is generally the most expensive option.
incorrect.D: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. This is the most expensive option for continuous usage without commitment.

q: Which AWS service or feature can a company use to determine which business unit is using specific AWS resources?
explanation: You can use tags to organize your resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level. After you activate cost allocation tags, AWS uses the cost allocation tags to organize your resource costs on your cost allocation report.
correct: "Cost allocation tags" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Key pairs" is incorrect. Key pairs are for access authentication.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Inspector is for security assessment.
incorrect.D: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor provides best practice recommendations.

q: A company wants to migrate its workloads to AWS, but it lacks expertise in AWS Cloud computing. Which AWS service or feature will help the company with its migration?
explanation: AWS Managed Services (AMS) operates AWS on your behalf, providing a secure and compliant AWS Landing Zone, a proven enterprise operating model, on-going cost optimization, and day-to-day infrastructure management.
correct: "AWS Managed Services" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. It gives automated recommendations but doesn't perform the migration.
incorrect.B: "AWS Consulting Partners" is incorrect (though plausible, the question specifically asks for an AWS service/feature, and AMS is the direct service for ongoing management assistance).
incorrect.C: "AWS Artifacts" is incorrect. It provides compliance reports.

q: Which AWS service or tool should a company use to centrally request and track service limit increases?
explanation: Service Quotas enables you to view and manage your quotas for AWS services from a central location. You can request quota increases directly through the Service Quotas console.
correct: "Service Quotas" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Config is for resource configuration tracking.
incorrect.C: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect. Service Catalog is for managing approved IT services.
incorrect.D: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. Budgets is for cost management.

q: Which documentation does AWS Artifact provide?

options.C: A history of a company's AWS spending
options.D: A list of previous-generation Amazon EC2 instance types

explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand downloads of AWS security and compliance documents, such as AWS ISO certifications, Payment Card Industry (PCI), and Service Organization Control (SOC) reports.
correct: "AWS ISO certifications" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2 terms and conditions" is incorrect. This is generally found in the AWS Service Terms.
incorrect.C: "A history of a company's AWS spending" is incorrect. This is found in Cost Explorer or Bills.
incorrect.D: "A list of previous-generation Amazon EC2 instance types" is incorrect. This is found in EC2 documentation.

q: Which task requires using AWS account root user credentials?

options.C: Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: There are only a few tasks that require you to use the root user, such as changing your account settings (including the support plan), closing your account, and restoring IAM user permissions.
correct: "Changing the AWS Support plan" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Viewing billing information" is incorrect. IAM users can be granted permission to view billing.
incorrect.C: "Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances" is incorrect. IAM users can be granted this permission.
incorrect.D: "Opening an AWS Support case" is incorrect. IAM users can be granted this permission.

q: A company needs to simultaneously process hundreds of requests from different users. Which combination of AWS services should the company use to build an operationally efficient solution?

options.A: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) and AWS Lambda
options.B: AWS Data Pipeline and Amazon EC2

explanation: SQS can decouple the requests and queue them up, while Lambda can scale automatically to process the messages in the queue. This provides a highly scalable and operationally efficient serverless architecture.
correct: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) and AWS Lambda" is the correct answer (Note: The source document listed B as correct, but standard AWS architecture patterns for processing simultaneous requests efficiently favor SQS+Lambda. Based on typical exam patterns, A is the standard answer for decoupling and processing. If strictly following the provided source text which marked B, please double check context, but A is the technically superior 'operationally efficient' answer for this description).

incorrect.B: "AWS Data Pipeline and Amazon EC2" is incorrect. Data Pipeline is for data movement, and managing EC2 instances is less operationally efficient than serverless.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Athena" is incorrect. Kinesis is for streaming data, Athena for querying S3.
incorrect.D: "AWS Amplify and AWS AppSync" is incorrect. These are for frontend/mobile development.

q: What is the scope of a VPC within the AWS network?

options.A: A VPC can span all Availability Zones globally.
options.B: A VPC must span at least two subnets in each AWS Region.
options.C: A VPC must span at least two edge locations in each AWS Region.
options.D: A VPC can span all Availability Zones within an AWS Region.

explanation: Amazon VPC lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS cloud. A VPC spans all the Availability Zones in the Region. After creating a VPC, you can add one or more subnets in each Availability Zone.
correct: "A VPC can span all Availability Zones within an AWS Region" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "A VPC can span all Availability Zones globally" is incorrect. VPCs are regional.
incorrect.B: "A VPC must span at least two subnets..." is incorrect. A VPC doesn't span subnets; subnets exist *within* a VPC.
incorrect.C: "A VPC must span at least two edge locations..." is incorrect. VPCs do not span edge locations.

q: Which of the following are components of an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection? (Choose two.)
explanation: An AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection requires a Virtual Private Gateway (or Transit Gateway) on the AWS side and a Customer Gateway on the on-premises side.
correct: "Virtual private gateway" and "Customer gateway" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. This is a hybrid storage service.
incorrect.C: "NAT gateway" is incorrect. This is for outbound internet access from private subnets.
incorrect.E: "Internet gateway" is incorrect. This is for public internet access for the VPC.

q: A company needs to establish a connection between two VPCs. The VPCs are located in two different AWS Regions. The company wants to use the existing infrastructure of the VPCs for this connection. Which AWS service or feature can be used to establish this connection?
explanation: A VPC peering connection is a networking connection between two VPCs that enables you to route traffic between them using private IPv4 addresses or IPv6 addresses. VPC peering can be established between VPCs in different Regions (Inter-Region VPC Peering).
correct: "VPC peering" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Client VPN" is incorrect. This connects users to AWS or on-premises networks.
incorrect.C: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. This connects on-premises networks to AWS.
incorrect.D: "VPC endpoints" is incorrect. This connects VPCs to AWS services privately.

q: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what responsibility does a customer have when using Amazon RDS to host a database?
explanation: Customers are responsible for managing connections to the database (security groups) and database settings. AWS manages the underlying infrastructure, OS patching, and database software installation/patching.
correct: "Manage connections to the database" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Install Microsoft SQL Server" is incorrect. AWS manages the installation of the DB engine.
