explanation: Tags allow you to assign metadata to resources. You can use cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level (e.g., by application, cost center).
correct: "Create cost allocation tags" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Set up invoiced billing" is incorrect. This is a payment method.
incorrect.B: "Use AWS Artifact" is incorrect. This is for compliance reports.
incorrect.C: "Set the budgets..." is incorrect. Budgets track overall spend, but tags are needed to distinguish *individual* apps within a single account.

q: On an Amazon EC2 instance, a batch job takes 5 hours to complete. Monthly, the quantity of data to be processed doubles, and the time required to process it is proportionate. What is the optimal cloud architecture for meeting this escalating demand?

options.A: Run the application on a bigger EC2 instance size.
options.B: Switch to an EC2 instance family that better matches batch requirements.
options.C: Distribute the application across multiple EC2 instances and run the workload in parallel.
options.D: Run the application on a bare metal EC2 instance.

explanation: Horizontal scaling (distributing across multiple instances) is the best way to handle escalating demand for batch jobs that can be parallelized. Vertical scaling (bigger instance) has limits.
correct: "Distribute the application across multiple EC2 instances and run the workload in parallel" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Run the application on a bigger EC2 instance size" is incorrect. Eventually, you will hit the maximum instance size.
incorrect.B: "Switch to an EC2 instance family..." is incorrect. Helps, but doesn't solve exponential growth.
incorrect.D: "Run the application on a bare metal EC2 instance" is incorrect. Similar limitation to vertical scaling.

q: A company has a workload that will run continuously for 1 year. The workload cannot tolerate service interruptions. Which Amazon EC2 purchasing option will be MOST cost-effective?
explanation: Reserved Instances (RIs) offer a significant discount compared to On-Demand. 'All Upfront' payment option provides the largest discount.
correct: "All Upfront Reserved Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Partial Upfront Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Offers less discount than All Upfront.
incorrect.D: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. Most expensive for continuous workloads.

q: How can AWS Trusted Advisor assist AWS Cloud users? (Select two.)

options.A: It identifies software vulnerabilities in applications running on AWS
options.B: It provides a list of cost optimization recommendations based on current AWS usage
options.C: It detects potential security vulnerabilities caused by permissions settings on account resources
options.D: It automatically corrects potential security issues caused by permissions settings on account resources
options.E: It provides proactive alerting whenever an Amazon EC2 instance has been compromised

explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations in five categories: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits. It identifies unused resources (cost) and open security groups (security).
correct: "It provides a list of cost optimization recommendations..." and "It detects potential security vulnerabilities..." are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "It identifies software vulnerabilities..." is incorrect. This is Amazon Inspector.
incorrect.D: "It automatically corrects..." is incorrect. It recommends, usually doesn't auto-correct (requires action).
incorrect.E: "It provides proactive alerting... compromised" is incorrect. This is Amazon GuardDuty.

q: Which AWS function will assist users in determining the CPU capacity of an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors your AWS resources. It provides metrics for EC2 instances, including CPUUtilization.
correct: "Amazon CloudWatch" is the correct answer.

q: A user may create a master payer account in order to access aggregated billing data via:
explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to create a management account (formerly master account) and member accounts. It provides consolidated billing features.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. Budgets tracks spending but doesn't create the account structure.

q: Every few years, a business invests several months in modernizing its on-premises infrastructure. The organization wishes to shorten the time required for infrastructure purchase by shifting to the AWS Cloud. What is the primary advantage of transferring this use case to the AWS Cloud?

options.A: AWS will help move the existing hardware to the AWS data centers.
options.B: The company will have increased agility with on-demand access to IT resources.
options.C: Enterprise support will be available to help with recurring application installation and setup.
options.D: The company will experience less downtime with Multi-AZ deployments.

explanation: In the cloud, you can provision resources in minutes instead of waiting months for hardware. This is 'Agility'.
correct: "The company will have increased agility with on-demand access to IT resources" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS will help move the existing hardware..." is incorrect. AWS does not host your old hardware.
incorrect.C: "Enterprise support..." is incorrect. This is a support tier, not the primary infrastructure advantage.
incorrect.D: "The company will experience less downtime..." is incorrect. While true, the question asks about shortening the *time required for purchase*.

q: Which AWS service helps protect against DDoS attacks?
explanation: AWS Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service that safeguards applications running on AWS.
correct: "AWS Shield" is the correct answer.

q: Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering allows customers to aggregate billing for many accounts?
explanation: You can use the consolidated billing feature in AWS Organizations to consolidate billing and payment for multiple AWS accounts.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon QuickSight" is incorrect.

q: Which of the following are advantages of Amazon Web Services' cloud computing platform? (Select two.)
explanation: Elasticity (scaling) and Agility (speed to market) are core benefits of the AWS cloud. CapEx is replaced by OpEx.
correct: "Elasticity" and "Agility" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Unlimited uptime" is incorrect. No service guarantees 100% uptime forever.
incorrect.E: "Capital expenses" is incorrect.

q: An application installed in the AWS Cloud exhibits irregular consumption patterns and is responsible for non-stop workloads. Which Amazon EC2 pricing plan is the MOST cost-effective for this application?
explanation: While 'non-stop' implies Reserved, 'irregular consumption patterns' with 'application installed... exhibits' often implies the usage *fluctuates* unpredictably, making RIs hard to commit to perfectly, or it refers to On-Demand being the standard for irregular/spiky workloads. (Note: The source document selects D. If the workload is truly constant 'non-stop' at a fixed baseline, Reserved would be better. However, based on 'irregular', On-Demand is the flexible choice provided in the source).
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Dedicated Instances" is incorrect. Expensive.
incorrect.B: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Can be interrupted.
incorrect.C: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Best for steady-state, predictable usage.

q: Which service's primary aim is to manage software versions?
explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a source control service that hosts secure Git-based repositories. It makes it easy for teams to collaborate on code in a secure and highly scalable ecosystem (Version Control).
correct: "AWS CodeCommit" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon CodeStar" is incorrect. Project management tool.
incorrect.B: "AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)" is incorrect. Management tool.

q: A business is now undergoing a security examination. The audit includes a security and compliance review of the company's AWS infrastructure and services. The auditor must identify and download AWS security and compliance materials. The System and Organization Control (SOC) reports are one of these documents. Which AWS service or collection of services is capable of providing these documents?
explanation: AWS Artifact is the central resource for compliance-related information that matters to you. It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Abuse team" is incorrect.

q: Using AWS Config to record, audit, and evaluate changes to AWS resources to enable traceability is an example of which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar?
explanation: The Security pillar includes the ability to protect information, systems, and assets while delivering business value through risk assessments and mitigation strategies. Auditing and traceability are key components of security.
correct: "Security" is the correct answer.

q: Which of the following is a design concept for AWS Cloud architecture?
explanation: Loose coupling allows components to operate independently, increasing system resilience and scalability. If one component fails, it shouldn't break the whole system.
correct: "Implement loose coupling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Implement single points of failure" is incorrect. You should avoid SPOFs.
incorrect.C: "Implement monolithic design" is incorrect. You should avoid monoliths.
incorrect.D: "Implement vertical scaling" is incorrect. Cloud favors horizontal scaling.

q: The continuous lowering in AWS Cloud price is a result of the following:
explanation: Because AWS has hundreds of thousands of customers, they can aggregate usage to achieve massive economies of scale, which translates to lower prices.
correct: "economies of scale" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "pay-as-you go pricing" is incorrect. This is a billing model.

q: Which phase discusses agility as an advantage of AWS Cloud-based development?

options.A: The ability to pay only when computing resources are consumed, based on the volume of resources that are consumed
options.B: The ability to eliminate guessing about infrastructure capacity needs
options.C: The ability to support innovation through a reduction in the time that is required to make IT resources available to developers
options.D: The ability to deploy an application in multiple AWS Regions around the world in minutes

explanation: Agility in the cloud refers to the speed at which you can develop, test, and launch applications. Reducing the time to make resources available directly supports this.
correct: "The ability to support innovation through a reduction in the time that is required to make IT resources available to developers" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "The ability to pay only..." is incorrect. This is variable expense.
incorrect.B: "The ability to eliminate guessing..." is incorrect. This is elasticity.
incorrect.D: "The ability to deploy..." is incorrect. This is Global Reach.

q: Which AWS tool or feature acts as a VPC firewall at the subnet level?
explanation: A Network Access Control List (ACL) acts as a firewall for controlling traffic in and out of one or more subnets.
correct: "Network ACL" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security group" is incorrect. Acts at the instance level.
incorrect.C: "Traffic Mirroring" is incorrect. Copies traffic for analysis.
incorrect.D: "Internet gateway" is incorrect. Connects VPC to internet.

q: A business wishes to deliver managed Windows virtual desktops and programs through secure network connections to its distant workers. Which AWS services does the business have access to in order to achieve these requirements? (Select two.)
explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed desktop-as-a-service (DaaS) solution. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed application streaming service.
correct: "Amazon AppStream 2.0" and "Amazon WorkSpaces" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. Contact center.
incorrect.E: "Amazon Elastic Container Service" is incorrect. Container orchestration.

q: Which of the following is an AWS shared responsibility?
explanation: AWS is responsible for the physical hardware and the infrastructure that runs the cloud services. (Note: The wording 'shared responsibility' can be ambiguous, but usually asks what part *of* the model is AWS's responsibility versus Customer. D is definitely AWS).
correct: "Maintaining physical hardware" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Identity and access management (IAM)" is incorrect. Customer configures IAM.
incorrect.B: "Server-side encryption (SSE)" is incorrect. Customer chooses to enable.
incorrect.C: "Firewall configuration" is incorrect. Customer configures SG/NACL.

q: Which storage service can be utilized to host static webpages at a minimal cost?
explanation: Amazon S3 supports static website hosting. It is very cost-effective compared to running a server.
correct: "Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Glacier" is incorrect. Archive storage.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. File storage.

q: Which AWS service can be used to decouple applications?
explanation: Amazon SQS is a message queuing service used to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.
correct: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Resource tracking.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is incorrect. Email.

q: Which AWS services are globally specified rather than regionally defined? (Select two.)
explanation: IAM, Route 53, and CloudFront are examples of Global services. EC2, S3, and DynamoDB are Regional.
correct: "Amazon Route 53" and "Amazon CloudFront" are the correct answers.

incorrect.C: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. Regional (buckets are created in a region).
incorrect.E: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. Regional.

q: Currently, a company's online program is highly dependent on underlying components, which means that when one component fails, the whole web site crashes. Which AWS Cloud design concept is most appropriate for resolving the present design issue?

options.A: Implementing elasticity, enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
options.B: Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
options.C: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
options.D: Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

explanation: Decoupling components ensures that the failure of one component does not cascade and cause the entire system to fail. Services like SQS are used for this.
correct: "Focusing on decoupling components..." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Implementing elasticity..." is incorrect. Helps with load, not necessarily component failure isolation.
incorrect.B: "Enabling several EC2 instances..." is incorrect. This is scaling, not decoupling.
incorrect.D: "Doubling EC2 computing resources..." is incorrect. Scaling up doesn't fix architectural dependency.

q: A user must locate, categorize, and safeguard sensitive data stored in Amazon S3 automatically. Which AWS service satisfies these criteria?
explanation: Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service that uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and protect your sensitive data in AWS.
correct: "Amazon Macie" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Vulnerability scanning for EC2.
incorrect.D: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect. Secret management.

q: On an Amazon EC2 instance, a business hosts an application. Several AWS resources, including Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB, are required by the EC2 instance. What is the MOST OPTIMAL way to delegate permissions?

options.A: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
options.B: Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key in the application.
options.C: Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key to create a CLI profile in the EC2 instance
options.D: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the administrative IAM user.

explanation: Using an IAM role attached to the EC2 instance allows the application to obtain temporary credentials automatically, which is more secure than storing long-term access keys.
correct: "Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance." is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Create an IAM user..." is incorrect. Hardcoding keys is bad practice.
incorrect.C: "Create a CLI profile..." is incorrect. Storing keys on instance is less secure than roles.
incorrect.D: "Attach the role to the administrative IAM user" is incorrect. The role needs to be assumed by the *service* (EC2), not a user.

q: Which of the following are support categories for AWS Trusted Advisor? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks are categorized into: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits.
correct: "Cost optimization" and "Security" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Operational excellence" is incorrect. This is a Well-Architected Pillar, not a specific Trusted Advisor category name (though Performance covers some aspects).
incorrect.E: "Rightsizing" is incorrect. This is a *check* within Cost Optimization, not a category itself.

q: Which disaster recovery option is the LEAST expensive?
explanation: Backup and Restore is generally the cheapest DR strategy because you are not running compute resources continuously in the DR site, only storage costs.
correct: "Backup and restore" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Warm standby" is incorrect. Requires running some resources.
incorrect.B: "Multisite" is incorrect. Requires full active environment.
incorrect.D: "Pilot light" is incorrect. Requires some active resources (like DB).

q: Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an Amazon EC2 instance is stopped or terminated?
explanation: Instance Store provides temporary block-level storage for your instance. This storage is located on disks that are physically attached to the host computer. Data persists only while the instance is running.
correct: "Amazon EC2 instance store" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. EBS is persistent.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. EFS is persistent.
incorrect.D: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. S3 is persistent.

q: A company needs fully managed, highly reliable, and scalable file storage that is accessible over the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?

options.C: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

explanation: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server provides fully managed, highly reliable, and scalable file storage that is accessible over the industry-standard Service Message Block (SMB) protocol.
correct: "Amazon FSx for Windows File Server" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. Object storage.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. NFS protocol.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. Block storage.

q: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
explanation: The AWS Global Infrastructure consists of Regions, Availability Zones, and Edge Locations.
correct: "AWS Regions" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Alexa" is incorrect. Consumer service.

q: What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?

options.A: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
options.B: To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
options.C: To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
options.D: To load balance traffic from the internet across Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: An internet gateway allows communication between your VPC and the internet.
correct: "To allow communication between the VPC and the internet" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "To create a VPN connection..." is incorrect. That is Virtual Private Gateway.
incorrect.D: "To load balance traffic..." is incorrect. That is Elastic Load Balancer.

q: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?
explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Threat detection.
incorrect.B: "AWS Security Hub" is incorrect. Security posture management.

q: A company is planning an infrastructure deployment to the AWS Cloud. Before the deployment, the company wants a cost estimate for running the infrastructure. Which AWS service or feature can provide this information?
explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator allows you to estimate the cost for your architecture solution.
correct: "AWS Pricing Calculator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Cost Explorer" is incorrect. Analyzes *historical* and *current* costs.
incorrect.B: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Recommends optimization for *existing* resources.
incorrect.C: "AWS Cost and Usage Report" is incorrect. Reports actual usage.

q: How can Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups contribute to a web application's high availability?

options.A: They automatically add more instances across multiple AWS Regions based on global demand of the application.
options.B: They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones when the application needs it.
options.C: They enable the application's static content to reside closer to end users.
options.D: They are able to distribute incoming requests across a tier of web server instances.

explanation: Auto Scaling ensures you have the correct number of instances running to handle the load and can replace unhealthy instances, spreading them across Availability Zones for high availability.
correct: "They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones..." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "They automatically add more instances across multiple AWS Regions..." is incorrect. Auto Scaling Groups are regional.
incorrect.C: "They enable the application's static content..." is incorrect. This is CloudFront.
incorrect.D: "They are able to distribute incoming requests..." is incorrect. This is ELB.

q: A business has a stateless application workload that can withstand brief periods of outage. The program conducts calculations in massively parallel fashion. Which Amazon EC2 pricing model should the business choose to save costs?
explanation: Spot Instances offer the lowest price but can be interrupted. They are ideal for stateless, fault-tolerant, and flexible workloads.
correct: "Spot Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. More expensive.
incorrect.C: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Requires commitment, less flexible for brief periods.

q: Which of the following is a method for enhancing AWS security? (Select two.)

options.B: Granting the broadest permissions to all IAM roles
options.C: Running application code with AWS Cloud9
options.D: Enabling multi-factor authentication (MFA) with Amazon Cognito
options.E: Using AWS Trusted Advisor security checks

explanation: MFA adds an extra layer of protection. AWS Trusted Advisor security checks identify security vulnerabilities.
correct: "Enabling multi-factor authentication (MFA) with Amazon Cognito" (Note: while valid for apps, the question is general, and enabling MFA in general is good. Source marked D & E) and "Using AWS Trusted Advisor security checks" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Using AWS Artifact" is incorrect. This is for compliance reporting.
incorrect.B: "Granting the broadest permissions..." is incorrect. You should grant *least privilege*.
incorrect.C: "Running application code with AWS Cloud9" is incorrect. This is an IDE, doesn't inherently enhance security of the app logic itself.

q: Which AWS service of tool helps to centrally manage billing and allow controlled access to resources across AWS accounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to consolidate billing for multiple accounts and manage access policies (SCPs).
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)" is incorrect. IAM is for single account access management.
incorrect.D: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. For tracking costs.

q: Under the AWS shared responsibility paradigm, the following parties are responsible for the security and patching of the guest operating system:
explanation: Customers are responsible for "Security in the Cloud," which includes the guest OS, applications, and data.
correct: "the customer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Support" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "AWS Systems Manager" is incorrect. It's a tool the customer can *use*, but the responsibility lies with the customer.

q: What is an example of AWS Cloud's high availability?

options.A: Consulting AWS technical support at any time day or night
options.B: Ensuring an application remains accessible, even if a resource fails
options.C: Making any AWS service available for use by paying on demand
options.D: Deploying in any part of the world using AWS Regions

explanation: High availability refers to the ability of a system to remain operational and accessible even when some components fail.
correct: "Ensuring an application remains accessible, even if a resource fails" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Consulting AWS technical support..." is incorrect. This is support availability.
incorrect.C: "Making any AWS service available..." is incorrect. This is on-demand provisioning.
incorrect.D: "Deploying in any part of the world..." is incorrect. This is Global Reach.

q: Which of the following are Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) resources?
explanation: Subnets and Internet Gateways are core components of a VPC.
correct: "Subnets; internet gateways" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Objects; access control lists (ACLs)" is incorrect. Objects are S3.
incorrect.C: "Access policies; buckets" is incorrect. Buckets are S3.
incorrect.D: "Groups; roles" is incorrect. These are IAM.

q: Which aspects of AWS make it cost viable for workloads with fluctuating customer demand? (Select two.)
explanation: Elasticity allows you to match resources to demand, and pay-as-you-go pricing ensures you don't pay for idle resources when demand is low.
correct: "Elasticity" and "Pay-as-you-go pricing" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "High availability" is incorrect. This is for uptime.
incorrect.B: "Shared security model" is incorrect. This is for security.
incorrect.E: "Reliability" is incorrect. This is for recovery.

q: A business wants to migrate 40TB of data from on-premises storage systems to Amazon S3. The transfer must occur as rapidly as feasible while maintaining a low cost. The firm has internet access at a speed of 100 megabits per second. Which AWS service will satisfy these criteria?
explanation: Transferring 40TB over 100Mbps would take a very long time (months). AWS Snowball moves data physically and is much faster for this volume and bandwidth.
correct: "AWS Snowball" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Takes time to provision and costs more.
incorrect.C: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. Still uses the internet link.
incorrect.D: "Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration" is incorrect. Still limited by the 100Mbps uplink.

q: Which of the following allows customers to programmatically access the power of AWS services?
explanation: The AWS CLI is a unified tool to manage your AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts (programmatic access).
correct: "AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Optimization tool.
incorrect.D: "AWS Management Console" is incorrect. GUI access.

q: A business wishes to migrate some of its resources to the AWS Cloud. To comply with regulatory standards, data must stay on-premises and local. AWS and the company's resources must have a low latency. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service or functionality may be leveraged to fulfill these requirements?
explanation: AWS Outposts allow you to run AWS infrastructure and services on-premises for a truly consistent hybrid experience, meeting data residency and low latency requirements.
correct: "AWS Outposts" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Local Zones" is incorrect. Closer to users, but not on-premises.
incorrect.B: "Availability Zones" is incorrect. In AWS Regions.
incorrect.D: "AWS Wavelength Zones" is incorrect. For 5G networks.

q: A business has specified the Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources it requires for a new application. The business must determine the expenses associated with operating the application on AWS. What actions should the business take to comply with this stipulation?

options.A: Take advantage of AWS on-demand pricing.
options.B: Use the AWS Pricing Calculator to generate an approximate dollar amount.
options.C: Use Amazon QuickSight to analyze current on-premises spending.
options.D: Use Amazon AppStream 2.0 for real-time pricing analytics.

explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator is the tool used to estimate costs for AWS services.
correct: "Use the AWS Pricing Calculator to generate an approximate dollar amount" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Take advantage of AWS on-demand pricing" is incorrect. This is a purchasing option, not an estimation tool.
incorrect.C: "Use Amazon QuickSight..." is incorrect. This is for BI.
incorrect.D: "Use Amazon AppStream 2.0..." is incorrect. This is for app streaming.

q: For its steady-state database, a corporation runs a self-managed Oracle database directly on Amazon EC2. The corporation wishes to cut its computing expenses. Which option should the business choose in order to optimize savings over a three-year period?
explanation: Reserved Instances provide the highest discount for steady-state usage over a 1 or 3 year term.
correct: "EC2 Reserved Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "EC2 Dedicated Instances" is incorrect. Expensive.
incorrect.B: "EC2 Spot Instances" is incorrect. Not suitable for steady-state database (can be interrupted).
incorrect.D: "EC2 On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. Most expensive.

q: A corporation is developing an application that must distribute photos and videos internationally with the least amount of delay possible. Which strategy may the business take to do this in the most cost-effective manner?

options.A: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
options.B: Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication.
options.C: Implement a VPN across multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink.

explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that caches content at Edge Locations globally, providing the lowest latency for international distribution.
correct: "Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication" is incorrect. This replicates storage but doesn't cache content closer to users as effectively or cheaply for read delivery as CloudFront.
incorrect.D: "Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink" is incorrect. PrivateLink is for private connectivity to services, not global content delivery.

q: Which AWS service or functionality gives advice to customers about frequently asked billing questions?
explanation: All AWS account owners have access to account and billing support free of charge. The AWS Knowledge Center is the repository for frequently asked questions.
correct: "AWS Knowledge Center" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Marketplace" is incorrect. It is for software procurement.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Pinpoint" is incorrect. It is for customer engagement.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. It is for contact centers.

q: Which AWS services enable an on-premises infrastructure to be extended to the AWS Cloud? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS Direct Connect makes it easy to establish a dedicated network connection from your premises to AWS. AWS Storage Gateway enables hybrid cloud storage by connecting on-premises applications to AWS storage.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" and "AWS Storage Gateway" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EBS" is incorrect. Block storage in the cloud.
incorrect.E: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. Contact center.

q: Which AWS service enables the generation of warnings based on a monthly bill estimate?
explanation: You can monitor your estimated AWS charges by using Amazon CloudWatch. When you enable the monitoring of estimated charges, you can set alarms to warn you when the bill exceeds a threshold.
correct: "Amazon CloudWatch" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Configuration tracking.

q: A company needs to identify the last time that a specific user accessed the AWS Management Console. Which AWS service will provide this information?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail enables auditing, security monitoring, and operational troubleshooting by tracking user activity and API usage. It logs console sign-in events.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Cognito" is incorrect. Identity management for apps.

q: Which AWS service may be utilized to deploy the application?
explanation: AWS CodePipeline is a continuous delivery service you can use to model, visualize, and automate the steps required to release your software.
correct: "AWS CodePipeline" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS AppSync" is incorrect. GraphQL service.

q: Which AWS service or functionality is by default highly available?
explanation: Amazon RDS supports options for ensuring High Availability (Multi-AZ). (Note: While standard RDS is not HA by default without configuration, the source selects D citing the support for Multi-AZ options).
correct: "Amazon RDS" is the correct answer based on the source document context.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2" is incorrect. Single instance is not HA.
incorrect.C: "NAT instances" is incorrect. Single instance is not HA.

q: A business requires data migration from its on-premises environment to the AWS Cloud. The business demands extremely elastic and efficient connection. Which AWS service satisfies these criteria?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage. It connects on-premises software appliances with cloud-based storage.
correct: "AWS Storage Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. Archive storage.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. Cloud file system.

q: A company wants to perform sentiment analysis on customer service email messages that it receives. The company wants to identify whether the customer service engagement was positive or negative. Which AWS service should the company use to perform this analysis?
explanation: Amazon Comprehend uses natural language processing (NLP) to extract insights about the content of documents, including sentiment analysis.
correct: "Amazon Comprehend" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Textract" is incorrect. Extracts text from documents.

q: What is the total amount of storage offered by Amazon S3?
explanation: The total volume of data and number of objects you can store in Amazon S3 are unlimited.
correct: "Unlimited" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "100MB" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "5 TB" is incorrect. This is the max size for a *single object*.

q: Which AWS service or functionality is exclusively accessible to AWS Enterprise Support customers?
explanation: The AWS Concierge Support team is a dedicated team of enterprise account specialists available only to Enterprise Support customers to help with billing and account inquiries.
correct: "AWS Concierge Support team" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Available to all (with limited checks for Basic/Developer).
incorrect.B: "AWS Support case" is incorrect. Available to paid support tiers.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. Available to all users.

q: Which resource is the MOST EFFECTIVE for keeping current on AWS security announcements?
explanation: AWS Security Bulletins are public notifications posted on the AWS Security website regarding security and privacy events.
correct: "AWS Security Bulletins" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Personal Health Dashboard" is incorrect. For operational issues affecting your resources.
incorrect.B: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect. For credential management.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. For vulnerability scanning.

q: Which AWS services aid in application performance optimization by lowering latency associated with global content access? (Select two.)
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN for content caching. AWS Global Accelerator improves global application performance by routing traffic through the AWS global network.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" and "AWS Global Accelerator" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "AWS VPN" is incorrect. For private connectivity.
incorrect.C: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. For private connectivity from on-prem.
incorrect.E: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. For archiving.

q: Which AWS service should a company use to create a NoSQL database?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.
correct: "Amazon DynamoDB" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Aurora" is incorrect. Relational.

q: Which techniques are available for deriving AWS charges by department? (Select two.)

options.A: Enable multi-factor authentication for the AWS account root user.
options.B: Create separate accounts for each department.
options.D: Use tags to associate each instance with a particular department.

explanation: Creating separate accounts (and using consolidated billing) is a strong isolation method. Using cost allocation tags allows tracking within an account.
correct: "Create separate accounts for each department" and "Use tags to associate each instance with a particular department" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Enable multi-factor authentication..." is incorrect. Security practice.
incorrect.C: "Use Reserved Instances..." is incorrect. Cost saving measure.
incorrect.E: "Pay bills using purchase orders" is incorrect. Payment method.

q: Which AWS services can be utilized to automate infrastructure? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS CloudFormation provides infrastructure as code. AWS OpsWorks provides managed Chef and Puppet for configuration management/automation.
correct: "AWS CloudFormation" and "AWS OpsWorks" are the correct answers.

incorrect.E: "Amazon QuickSight" is incorrect. Business Intelligence.

q: The solutions architect of a business want to deploy a few Amazon EC2 instances in an already-existing AWS account. Before the firm can accept the request, it wants a cost estimate. Which AWS tool should be used to generate the cost estimate?
explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator is a web-based planning tool to create estimates for AWS use cases before building them.
correct: "AWS Pricing Calculator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.C: "AWS Cost and Usage Report" is incorrect. Detailed history.

q: A company is migrating to Amazon S3. The company needs to transfer 60 TB of data from an on-premises data center to AWS within 10 days. Which AWS service should the company use to accomplish this migration?
explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transport solution that is faster than internet transfer for large volumes (like 60TB) given typical bandwidth constraints.
correct: "AWS Snowball" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. Storage class.
incorrect.B: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is incorrect. Database migration.
incorrect.D: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Takes time to provision.

q: What type of database is Amazon DynamoDB?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed, serverless, key-value NoSQL database.
correct: "Key-value" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "In-memory" is incorrect. This is ElastiCache.

q: A retail company has recently migrated its website to AWS. The company wants to ensure that it is protected from SQL injection attacks. The website uses an Application Load Balancer to distribute traffic to multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a custom rule that blocks SQL injection attacks?
explanation: AWS WAF helps protect web applications from common web exploits like SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS).
correct: "AWS WAF" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security groups" is incorrect. Protocol/port filtering.

q: Which AWS services enable users to link their AWS Cloud resources to their on-premises resources? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS VPN and AWS Direct Connect are the primary services for establishing network connectivity between AWS and on-premises environments.
correct: "AWS VPN" and "AWS Direct Connect" are the correct answers.

incorrect.E: "AWS Managed Services" is incorrect. Operations management.

q: While an Amazon EC2 instance is only activated when it is required, it must stay active throughout the life of the procedure. What is the most acceptable method of purchase?
explanation: On-Demand instances are recommended for users that prefer the low cost and flexibility of Amazon EC2 without any up-front payment or long-term commitment, and for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted.
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Dedicated Instances" is incorrect. These are physically isolated at the hardware level and are more expensive.
incorrect.B: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Spot instances can be interrupted if AWS needs the capacity back.
incorrect.D: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. These require a long-term commitment (1 or 3 years).

q: A business's operations are conducted on-site. The business want to anticipate the costs associated with hosting a major application on AWS. Which AWS service or tool does the business have access to in order to collect this information?
explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator is a web-based planning tool that you can use to create estimates for your AWS use cases.
correct: "AWS Pricing Calculator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. Budgets tracks actual spend against a target.
incorrect.C: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor optimizes existing resources.
incorrect.D: "Cost Explorer" is incorrect. Cost Explorer analyzes historical and current costs.

q: How can a client strengthen the security of their Amazon Web Services (AWS) account logins? (Select two.)

options.C: Use Amazon Cognito to manage access

explanation: Enabling Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of security. Configuring a strong password policy ensures that users create complex passwords that are harder to crack.
correct: "Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)" and "Configure a strong password policy" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Configure AWS Certificate Manager" is incorrect. ACM manages SSL/TLS certificates.
incorrect.C: "Use Amazon Cognito to manage access" is incorrect. Cognito is for application user authentication.
incorrect.E: "Enable AWS Organizations" is incorrect. Organizations is for account management.

q: A big firm often has a single Amazon Web Services (AWS) account. What are the benefits of repurposing a single AWS account to create additional AWS accounts? (Select two.)

options.A: It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads.
options.B: Discounts can be applied on a quarterly basis by submitting cases in the AWS Management Console.
options.C: Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.
options.D: Having multiple accounts reduces the risks associated with malicious activity targeted at a single account.

incorrect.C: "All Upfront Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Pricing option.
incorrect.D: "AWS Cost Explorer" is incorrect. Cost analysis tool.

q: To utilize the AWS CLI, users must produce the following:
explanation: To access AWS services via the CLI, you need an Access Key ID and a Secret Access Key.
correct: "an access/secret key" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "a password policy" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "an API key" is incorrect. Typically used for API Gateway, not general AWS CLI authentication.

q: Which of the following is a benefit of moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Compute instances can be launched and terminated as needed to optimize costs.
options.B: Compute costs can be viewed in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.
options.C: Users retain full administrative access to their compute instances.
options.D: Users can optimize costs by permanently running enough instances at peak load.

explanation: The ability to launch and terminate instances on demand (elasticity) allows for cost optimization that isn't possible with fixed on-premises hardware.
correct: "Compute instances can be launched and terminated as needed to optimize costs" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Compute costs can be viewed..." is incorrect. While true, it's a feature, not the primary *benefit* of the move compared to the agility of A.
incorrect.C: "Users retain full administrative access..." is incorrect. True for EC2, but you have access on-prem too.
incorrect.D: "Users can optimize costs by permanently running..." is incorrect. This is over-provisioning, not optimization.

q: Which AWS service monitors AWS accounts for security threats?
explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors your AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity.
correct: "Amazon GuardDuty" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect. Secrets management.
incorrect.D: "AWS Certificate Manager (ACM)" is incorrect. Certificate management.

q: Which AWS solution enables customers to extend AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co-location settings, or on-premises facilities through a hybrid architecture?
explanation: AWS Outposts allow you to run AWS infrastructure on-premises.
correct: "AWS Outposts" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Snowmobile" is incorrect. Data transfer.
incorrect.B: "AWS Local Zones" is incorrect. Infrastructure extension, but not on-premise equipment.

q: Which service allows consumers to audit AWS API calls?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail captures a log of all API calls for an AWS account, enabling auditing.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service would be utilized to manage AWS access across numerous accounts in a centralized fashion?
explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage and govern your environment across multiple accounts using policies (SCPs).
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect.

q: Which benefit is included with an AWS Enterprise Support plan?

options.A: AWS Partner Network (APN) support at no cost.
options.B: Designated support from an AWS technical account manager (TAM)
options.D: AWS managed compliance as code with AWS Config

explanation: The Enterprise Support plan includes a designated Technical Account Manager (TAM).
correct: "Designated support from an AWS technical account manager (TAM)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Partner Network (APN) support..." is incorrect.

q: Which task does AWS perform automatically?

options.A: Encrypt data that is stored in Amazon DynamoDB.
options.D: Create TLS certificates for users' websites.

explanation: All user data stored in Amazon DynamoDB is fully encrypted at rest by default.
correct: "Encrypt data that is stored in Amazon DynamoDB" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Patch Amazon EC2 instances" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Encrypt user network traffic" is incorrect. Customer responsibility to configure.
incorrect.D: "Create TLS certificates..." is incorrect. Customer requests them via ACM.

q: Which Amazon Web Offerings (AWS) services provide computational capabilities? (Select two.)
explanation: Amazon EC2 provides virtual servers (compute), and AWS Lambda provides serverless compute.
correct: "Amazon EC2" and "AWS Lambda" are the correct answers.

incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. Storage.

q: Which opportunities does AWS provide for clients interested in learning about cloud security in an instructor-led training? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS Online Tech Talks and AWS Classroom Training are formats where instructors or experts present information.
correct: "AWS Online Tech Talks" and "AWS Classroom Training" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Tool.

q: A business wishes to launch a worldwide commercial application using Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2). The deployment solution should be constructed with the greatest degree of redundancy and fault tolerance possible. According to this scenario, the following Amazon EC2 instances should be deployed:

options.A: in a single Availability Zone in one AWS Region
options.B: with multiple Elastic Network Interfaces belonging to different subnets
options.C: across multiple Availability Zones in one AWS Region
options.D: across multiple Availability Zones in two AWS Regions

explanation: Deploying across multiple Availability Zones in *multiple* AWS Regions provides the greatest degree of redundancy and fault tolerance, protecting against even Region-wide failures.
correct: "across multiple Availability Zones in two AWS Regions" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "in a single Availability Zone..." is incorrect. Low fault tolerance.
incorrect.C: "across multiple Availability Zones in one AWS Region" is incorrect. Good, but less fault tolerant than multiple Regions.

q: Which tool is most suited for integrating the billing of previously distinct AWS accounts?
explanation: Consolidated billing (feature of AWS Organizations) is designed to integrate billing for multiple accounts.
correct: "Consolidated billing" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Detailed billing report" is incorrect. Report format.
incorrect.C: "AWS Cost and Usage report" is incorrect. Report format.
incorrect.D: "Cost allocation report" is incorrect. Report format.

q: Which AWS service or tool can a company use to visualize, understand, and manage AWS spending and usage over time?
explanation: Cost Explorer is specifically designed to visualize and analyze spending over time.
correct: "Cost Explorer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Recommendations.

q: How can deploying an application across several Availability Zones benefit you?

options.A: There is a lower risk of service failure if a natural disaster causes a service disruption in a given AWS Region.
options.B: The application will have higher availability because it can withstand a service disruption in one Availability Zone.
options.C: There will be better coverage as Availability Zones are geographically distant and can serve a wider area.
options.D: There will be decreased application latency that will improve the user experience.

explanation: Deploying across multiple AZs provides high availability and fault tolerance within a Region.
correct: "The application will have higher availability because it can withstand a service disruption in one Availability Zone" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "There is a lower risk of service failure if a natural disaster causes a service disruption in a given AWS Region" is incorrect. Multiple AZs in one region don't protect against region-wide failure.
incorrect.C: "There will be better coverage..." is incorrect. AZs are relatively close within a Region.
incorrect.D: "There will be decreased application latency..." is incorrect. This is usually achieved by Edge Locations or Global Accelerator.

q: Which of the following enables AWS customers to control billing expense allocations?

options.D: Running all operations on a single AWS account

explanation: Cost allocation tags allow you to categorize and track costs by assigning metadata to resources.
correct: "Tagging resources" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Limiting who can create resources" is incorrect. Controls spend but not allocation analysis.
incorrect.C: "Adding a secondary payment method" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "Running all operations on a single AWS account" is incorrect. Makes allocation harder.

q: A business is developing an application that will be hosted in a single AWS Region and will serve end customers located around the globe. The firm wishes to give low-latency access to application data to end users. Which of the following services will assist you in achieving your goal?

options.D: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) transfer acceleration

explanation: Amazon CloudFront uses a global network of edge locations to cache content closer to users, reducing latency.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Connects on-prem.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Route 53 global DNS" is incorrect. Routes traffic, but doesn't cache content to reduce latency for data transfer like CloudFront.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) transfer acceleration" is incorrect. Speeds up uploads to S3, not general app content delivery to users.

q: The application of a business has a variable start and finish time. Which pricing option for Amazon EC2 will be the MOST cost-effective?
explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective for workloads that are flexible (variable start/finish time) and can handle interruptions. (Note: Source selects B).
correct: "Spot Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. More expensive.
incorrect.C: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Requires steady state.

q: A new application is being developed by a business that will save and retrieve millions of photographs and movies. Which AWS service or feature offers the CHEAPEST underlying storage?
explanation: Amazon S3 is designed for object storage (photos, movies) and offers lower cost storage tiers compared to EBS or Instance Store for this volume of data.
correct: "Amazon S3" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2 instance store" is incorrect. Ephemeral and tied to instance.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. More expensive block storage.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. Messaging queue.

q: A business intends to use the AWS Cloud to host a huge ecommerce application. The business must have an architecture that safeguards against network-based security threats such as DDoS assaults. Which Amazon Web Offerings (AWS) services should the business employ to achieve this requirement? (Select two.)
explanation: AWS Shield provides DDoS protection. Amazon CloudFront provides a distributed global network that can absorb DDoS attacks (and integrates with Shield).
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" and "AWS Shield" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Vulnerability scanning.
incorrect.B: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Threat detection (logging based), not mitigation of volumetric DDoS.
incorrect.E: "AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)" is incorrect. Authentication/Authorization.

q: Which AWS service or functionality enables the user to control application traffic between regions?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a global DNS service that can route traffic to resources in different regions based on latency, geography, or health.
correct: "Amazon Route 53" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon AppStream 2.0" is incorrect. App streaming.
incorrect.C: "Elastic Load Balancer" is incorrect. Regional distribution.

q: A company requires an isolated environment within AWS for security purposes. Which action can be taken to accomplish this?

options.A: Create a separate Availability Zone to host the resources.
options.B: Create a separate VPC to host the resources.
options.C: Create a placement group to host the resources.
options.D: Create an AWS Direct Connect connection between the company and AWS.

explanation: A VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) provides a logically isolated section of the AWS cloud where you can launch resources in a virtual network you define.
correct: "Create a separate VPC to host the resources" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Create a separate Availability Zone..." is incorrect. You cannot create AZs.
incorrect.C: "Create a placement group..." is incorrect. Placement groups control instance placement for performance.
incorrect.D: "Create an AWS Direct Connect..." is incorrect. Connects on-prem to AWS.

q: What expenses should be addressed when comparing the total cost of ownership (TCO) of an on-premises infrastructure to a cloud architecture? (Select two.)

options.A: The credit card processing fees for application transactions in the cloud.
options.B: The cost of purchasing and installing server hardware in the on-premises data.
options.C: The cost of administering the infrastructure, including operating system and software installations, patches, backups, and recovering from failures.
options.D: The costs of third-party penetration testing.
options.E: The advertising costs associated with an ongoing enterprise-wide campaign.

explanation: TCO comparison includes physical hardware costs (CapEx) and operational costs (OpEx) like administration, power, cooling, etc.
correct: "The cost of purchasing and installing server hardware..." and "The cost of administering the infrastructure..." are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "The credit card processing fees..." is incorrect. Likely similar in both.
incorrect.D: "The costs of third-party penetration testing" is incorrect. Applicable to both.
incorrect.E: "The advertising costs..." is incorrect. Not infrastructure costs.

q: Which service is an AWS-managed Hadoop framework that enables processing massive volumes of data across dynamically expandable Amazon EC2 instances simple, quick, and cost-effective?
explanation: Amazon EMR (Elastic MapReduce) is the AWS managed Hadoop framework.
correct: "Amazon EMR" is the correct answer.

incorrect.C: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk" is incorrect. App deployment.

q: What is the greatest place for a user to get information and reports on AWS compliance?
explanation: AWS Artifact is the central resource for compliance-related information and reports.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

q: A business wishes to be alerted when its AWS Cloud expenses or usage surpass certain limits. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering will meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Budgets allows you to set custom budgets and alert you when you exceed your budgeted amount.
correct: "AWS Budgets" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Cost Explorer" is incorrect. For analysis, not alerting on thresholds (though can show forecasts).
incorrect.D: "Amazon Macie" is incorrect. For data security.

q: Which AWS service is a highly available and scalable DNS web service?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS).
correct: "Amazon Route 53" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon VPC" is incorrect. Network.

q: A business needs to monitor changes to AWS resource configurations for compliance purposes. Which Amazon Web Services functionality may be utilized to fulfill this requirement?
explanation: AWS Config tracks configuration changes and Config Rules allow you to check those configurations against compliance guidelines.
correct: "AWS Config rules" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Cost and Usage Report" is incorrect. Billing.
incorrect.B: "AWS Organizations service control policies (SCPs)" is incorrect. Permissions governance.
incorrect.D: "VPC Flow Logs" is incorrect. Network traffic.

q: A customer requests advise on potential cost reductions associated with the migration from on-premises to AWS. Which tool is most appropriate in this situation?

options.C: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

explanation: The TCO Calculator (now Pricing Calculator/Migration Evaluator) helps estimate cost savings by moving to AWS.
correct: "AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS services or functionalities enable customers to establish a network connection between two virtual private clouds (VPCs)? (Select two.)
explanation: VPC Peering connects two VPCs directly. Transit Gateway acts as a hub to connect multiple VPCs.
correct: "VPC peering" and "AWS Transit Gateway" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "VPC endpoints" is incorrect. Connects VPC to AWS services.
incorrect.D: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Connects on-prem to AWS.

q: Which of the following is a recommended method for setting IAM user policies?

options.A: Start with a large set of permissions and remove the permissions that are not required.
options.C: Start with a minimum set of permissions and grant additional permissions as necessary.
options.D: Attach policies directly to each user individually.

explanation: The principle of least privilege states you should start with minimum permissions and grant more only as needed.
correct: "Start with a minimum set of permissions and grant additional permissions as necessary" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Start with a large set..." is incorrect. Insecure.
incorrect.B: "Use only Amazon managed policies" is incorrect. Custom policies are often needed.
incorrect.D: "Attach policies directly to each user..." is incorrect. Use groups.

q: How can consolidated billing benefit a business with many AWS accounts?

options.A: It aggregates usage across accounts so that the company can reach volume discount thresholds sooner.
options.B: It offers an additional 5% discount on purchases of All Upfront Reserved Instances.
options.C: It provides a simplified billing invoice that the company can process more quickly than a standard invoice.
options.D: It gives AWS resellers the ability to bill their customers for usage.

explanation: Consolidated billing combines usage, allowing you to reach volume discount tiers that exist for services like S3 and EC2 data transfer.
correct: "It aggregates usage across accounts so that the company can reach volume discount thresholds sooner" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "It offers an additional 5% discount..." is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "It provides a simplified billing invoice..." is incorrect. It provides a *consolidated* invoice, not necessarily simplified processing speed vs standard.

q: Which of the following is an AWS best practice for managing an AWS account root user?

options.A: Keep the root user password with the security team.
options.B: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
options.C: Create an access key for the root user.
options.D: Keep the root user password consistent for compliance purposes.

explanation: Enabling MFA for the root user is a critical security best practice.
correct: "Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Keep the root user password with the security team" is incorrect. Should be secured better than just 'with a team'.
incorrect.C: "Create an access key for the root user" is incorrect. Avoid this.
incorrect.D: "Keep the root user password consistent..." is incorrect. Rotate passwords.

q: AWS's pay-as-you-go pricing model:

options.B: requires payment up front for AWS services.
options.C: is relevant only for Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and Amazon RDS.

explanation: Pay-as-you-go replaces upfront capital expenditure (CapEx) with variable expense.
correct: "reduces capital expenditures" is the correct answer.

incorrect.C: "is relevant only for..." is incorrect. Applies to almost all services.
incorrect.D: "reduces operational expenditures" is incorrect. It shifts CapEx to OpEx, but doesn't necessarily reduce *OpEx* itself (though it can via optimization).

q: What AWS feature relates to a customer's flexibility to scale up and down applications to meet changeable demand?
explanation: Note: Elasticity is the specific term for scaling up and down based on demand. Scalability is the ability to grow. However, the source selects D (Scalability) here. Often Elasticity is the better answer for 'up AND down', but Scalability is also accepted in broad contexts.
correct: "Scalability" is the correct answer based on the source key.

incorrect.A: "Elasticity" is incorrect (in this specific source context, though technically very close/better).

q: A company wants to improve its security and audit posture by limiting Amazon EC2 inbound access. What should the company use to access instances remotely instead of opening inbound SSH ports and managing SSH keys?
explanation: Session Manager provides secure, auditable instance management without opening inbound ports or managing SSH keys.
correct: "AWS Systems Manager Session Manager" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "EC2 key pairs" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)" is incorrect.

q: After selecting an Amazon EC2 Dedicated Host reservation, which pricing option would provide the largest discount?
explanation: The 'All Upfront' payment option for reservations (including Dedicated Host reservations) always provides the largest discount compared to On-Demand.
correct: "All upfront payment" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "No upfront payment" is incorrect. Lowest discount.
incorrect.B: "Hourly on-demand payment" is incorrect. No discount.
incorrect.C: "Partial upfront payment" is incorrect. Medium discount.

q: Which AWS Cloud feature enables resource supply to be matched to changing workload demands?
explanation: Elasticity allows you to match resource supply to demand (scaling in/out) automatically.
correct: "Elasticity" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security" is incorrect.

q: A business has chosen to shift its production workloads to the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud. Which activities may assist in lowering operating expenses associated with the migration? (Select two.)

options.B: Rehost all third-party licenses on AWS.

explanation: Right-sizing (reducing overprovisioned instances) and using managed services (reducing operational overhead) are key strategies for cost optimization in the cloud.
correct: "Reduce overprovisioned instances" and "Use managed services" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Rehost all third-party licenses on AWS" is incorrect. This might save on new licenses but doesn't inherently lower OpEx compared to optimizing usage.
incorrect.C: "Implement a highly available architecture" is incorrect. This increases reliability but often increases cost (more resources).
incorrect.E: "Improve application security" is incorrect. While critical, it is not a primary method for lowering operating expenses.

q: A business want to provide a single user complete access to an Amazon S3 bucket. Which element in the S3 bucket policy contains information about the users who need access to the S3 bucket?
explanation: The Principal element in a policy specifies the user, account, service, or other entity that is allowed or denied access to a resource.
correct: "Principal" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Action" is incorrect. Describes what is allowed (e.g., s3:GetObject).
incorrect.C: "Resource" is incorrect. Describes the object (e.g., the bucket ARN).
incorrect.D: "Statement" is incorrect. The container for the policy elements.

q: Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) solution enables clients to acquire unused Amazon EC2 capacity at often reduced prices?
explanation: Spot Instances utilize unused EC2 capacity and are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
correct: "Spot Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Requires commitment.

q: How does the AWS global infrastructure offer high availability and fault tolerance to its users?

options.A: The AWS infrastructure is made up of multiple AWS Regions within various Availability Zones located in areas that have low flood risk, and are interconnected with low-latency networks and redundant power supplies.
options.B: The AWS infrastructure consists of subnets containing various Availability Zones with multiple data centers located in the same geographic location.
options.C: AWS allows users to choose AWS Regions and data centers so that users can select the closest data centers in different Regions.
options.D: The AWS infrastructure consists of isolated AWS Regions with independent Availability Zones that are connected with low-latency networking and redundant power supplies.

explanation: The AWS Global Infrastructure consists of Regions which contain multiple isolated Availability Zones. These AZs are connected with low-latency networking to allow for high availability and fault tolerance.
correct: "The AWS infrastructure consists of isolated AWS Regions with independent Availability Zones that are connected with low-latency networking and redundant power supplies" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "The AWS infrastructure is made up of multiple AWS Regions within various Availability Zones..." is incorrect. Regions contain AZs, not vice versa.
incorrect.B: "The AWS infrastructure consists of subnets containing various Availability Zones..." is incorrect. AZs contain subnets.
incorrect.C: "AWS allows users to choose AWS Regions and data centers..." is incorrect. Users choose Regions and AZs, not specific data centers.

q: Which of the following procedures should a client perform while doing penetration testing on Amazon Web Services (AWS)?

options.A: Conduct penetration testing using Amazon Inspector, and then notify AWS support.
options.B: Request and wait for approval from the customer's internal security team, and then conduct testing.
options.C: Notify AWS support, and then conduct testing immediately.
options.D: Request and wait for approval from AWS support, and then conduct testing.

explanation: AWS customers are welcome to carry out security assessments or penetration tests against their AWS infrastructure without prior approval for many core services. Therefore, the primary hurdle is internal approval.
correct: "Request and wait for approval from the customer's internal security team, and then conduct testing" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Conduct penetration testing using Amazon Inspector..." is incorrect. Inspector is an automated vulnerability scanner, not a penetration test tool.
incorrect.C: "Notify AWS support..." is incorrect. Notification is no longer required for standard tests.
incorrect.D: "Request and wait for approval from AWS support..." is incorrect. Approval is no longer required.

q: Which service would be responsible for network connection in a hybrid design that incorporates Amazon Web Services?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable, providing a hybrid network connection.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon VPC" is incorrect. This is the cloud network.
incorrect.C: "AWS Directory Service" is incorrect. This is for directory management.
incorrect.D: "Amazon API Gateway" is incorrect. This is for API management.

q: What is the name given to the several, separate sites inside an AWS Region that are linked by low-latency networks?
explanation: Availability Zones are interconnected within a region for low latency and are physically separated to provide fault tolerance.
correct: "Availability Zones" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Direct Connects" is incorrect. Network service.
incorrect.C: "Edge locations" is incorrect. CDN caching sites.

q: Which of the following AWS services can be utilized to efficiently deliver big volumes of online video content? (Select two.)
explanation: Amazon S3 is used to store the video content reliably and cheaply. Amazon CloudFront is used to distribute that content globally with low latency.
correct: "Amazon S3" and "Amazom CloudFront" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. Hybrid storage.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic File System (EFS)" is incorrect. File system.

q: Which Amazon EC2 price option is appropriate for applications that need intermittent, spiky, or unexpected workloads?
explanation: On-Demand Instances are recommended for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted.
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. These are for flexible, interruptible workloads.
incorrect.B: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. Expensive and for licensing needs.
incorrect.D: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. For steady-state workloads.

q: A user is able to set up a master payer account to view consolidated billing reports through:
explanation: AWS Organizations provides the consolidated billing feature where a management (master) account pays the charges for all member accounts.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. Cost tracking.

q: Which of the following is a duty of the client under the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Customers retain control of what security they choose to implement to protect their own content, platform, applications, systems and networks (Security in the Cloud).
correct: "Application security" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Virtualization infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS Responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Physical security of hardware" is incorrect. AWS Responsibility.

q: Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service can be used to monitor illegal API calls?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail allows AWS customers to record API calls, providing an audit trail of activity. This can be used to monitor for unauthorized or illegal calls.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect. Configuration auditing.

q: An ecommerce firm predicts a significant rise in online traffic in the run-up to two very popular shopping holidays. Which AWS service or functionality enables dynamic resource adjustment in response to this change in demand?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling allows you to automatically add or remove EC2 instances according to conditions you define, such as scheduled scaling or predictive scaling for holiday traffic.
correct: "Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudTrail" is incorrect. Auditing.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Forecast" is incorrect. While it predicts, Auto Scaling is the service that *adjusts* the resources.

q: Which strategy contributes to the cost optimization of consumers migrating to the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Paying only for what is used
options.B: Purchasing hardware before it is needed
options.D: Purchasing for the maximum possible load

explanation: With AWS you only pay for what you use, helping your organization remain agile and avoid the costs of over-provisioning.
correct: "Paying only for what is used" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Purchasing hardware before it is needed" is incorrect. This is the on-prem model.
incorrect.C: "Manually provisioning cloud resources" is incorrect. Automation is generally better for optimization.
incorrect.D: "Purchasing for the maximum possible load" is incorrect. This leads to wasted capacity.

q: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility?

options.A: Maintaining the infrastructure needed to run AWS Lambda
options.B: Updating the operating system of Amazon DynamoDB instances
options.D: Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: The customer is responsible for managing the guest operating system (including updates and patches) for Amazon EC2.
correct: "Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Maintaining the infrastructure needed to run AWS Lambda" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.B: "Updating the operating system of Amazon DynamoDB instances" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Maintaining Amazon S3 infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.

q: Which design principle is achieved by following the reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
explanation: One of the design principles for Reliability is 'Test recovery procedures'. In the cloud, you can test how your workload fails and validate your recovery procedures.
correct: "Testing recovery procedures" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Vertical scaling" is incorrect. Horizontal scaling is generally preferred for reliability.
incorrect.B: "Manual failure recovery" is incorrect. You should automate recovery.
incorrect.D: "Changing infrastructure manually" is incorrect. You should manage change via automation.

q: What enables a business to give a low-latency experience to its worldwide users?

options.A: Using an AWS Region that is central to all users
options.B: Using a second Availability Zone in the AWS Region that is being used
options.C: Enabling caching in the AWS Region that is being used
options.D: Using edge locations to put content closer to all users

explanation: Edge locations (used by CloudFront) are physically closer to users than origin servers in Regions, providing lower latency content delivery.
correct: "Using edge locations to put content closer to all users" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Using an AWS Region that is central..." is incorrect. Latency will still be high for distant users.
incorrect.B: "Using a second Availability Zone..." is incorrect. This improves availability, not global latency.
incorrect.C: "Enabling caching in the AWS Region..." is incorrect. Caching needs to be at the edge, not just the origin region.

q: A business has optimized its workload by using certain AWS services in order to increase efficiency and minimize costs. Which cost management best practice does this case demonstrate?
explanation: Architecture optimization involves refining workloads to be more cost-conscious, such as selecting the right services and resource types.
correct: "Architecture optimization" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Resource controls" is incorrect. Permissions/limits.
