q: Which feature of cloud computing can AWS exhibit via its capacity to provide reduced variable prices as a consequence of big purchase volumes?
explanation: Economies of scale allow AWS to pass on savings to customers in the form of lower variable costs as they grow.
correct: "Economies of scale" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Pay-as-you-go pricing" is incorrect. This is the billing model itself, not the reason for price reduction.

q: A customer with an AWS Basic Support subscription has discovered that their AWS resources are being used for unauthorized purposes. What is the preferred mechanism for the user to notify AWS of the activity?

options.A: Contact the AWS Concierge Support team.
options.B: Contact an AWS technical account manager.

explanation: If you suspect abuse of AWS resources, you should contact the AWS Abuse team.
correct: "Contact the AWS Abuse team" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Contact the AWS Concierge Support team" is incorrect. For Enterprise billing support.
incorrect.B: "Contact an AWS technical account manager" is incorrect. For Enterprise support.
incorrect.D: "Contact the AWS Support team" is incorrect. Abuse has a specific channel.

q: Which AWS service should a business use to check the compliance of AWS resource settings on a continual basis?
explanation: AWS Config continuously monitors and records AWS resource configurations and allows you to automate the evaluation of recorded configurations against desired configurations (compliance).
correct: "AWS Config" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Organizations" is incorrect. Account management.
incorrect.D: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect. IT service management.

q: Which AWS Cloud feature relieves customers of the requirement to estimate future infrastructure consumption?

options.A: Easy and fast deployment of applications in multiple Regions around the world
options.D: Lower variable costs due to massive economies of scale

explanation: Elasticity allows you to provision only the resources you need and scale up or down automatically, eliminating the need to guess capacity.
correct: "Elasticity of the AWS Cloud" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Easy and fast deployment..." is incorrect. This is global reach/agility.
incorrect.B: "Security of the AWS Cloud" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "Lower variable costs..." is incorrect. This is cost savings.

q: A user needs to quickly deploy a non-relational database on AWS. The user does not want to manage the underlying hardware or the database software. Which AWS service can be used to accomplish this?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed, serverless, key-value NoSQL database.
correct: "Amazon DynamoDB" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon RDS" is incorrect. Relational.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect. Relational data warehouse.

q: Which pattern is suggested for creating an AWS highly available architecture?

options.A: Ensure that components have low-latency network connectivity.
options.B: Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load.
options.C: Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.
options.D: Use a monolithic application that handles all operations.

explanation: Fault tolerance and high availability require that the system remain operational even if a component fails.
correct: "Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Ensure that components have low-latency..." is incorrect. Good for performance, but doesn't guarantee HA.
incorrect.B: "Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load" is incorrect. This is expensive and doesn't guarantee availability against failure.
incorrect.D: "Use a monolithic application..." is incorrect. Single point of failure.

q: Which task is an AWS responsibility when a workload is running in Amazon RDS?
explanation: AWS manages the installation and patching of the database engine for Amazon RDS.
correct: "Installing the database engine" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Creating the database table" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.B: "Updating the database schema" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Dropping the database records" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.

q: A business is contemplating migrating its on-premises data center to Amazon Web Services (AWS). What aspects should a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) study consider? (Select two.)

options.B: Power consumption of the data center
options.C: Labor costs to replace old servers

explanation: TCO analysis includes facilities costs (power, cooling) and operational costs (labor for hardware maintenance) that are eliminated or reduced by moving to the cloud.
correct: "Power consumption of the data center" and "Labor costs to replace old servers" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2 instance availability" is incorrect. Performance metric, not cost input.
incorrect.D: "Application developer time" is incorrect. Development happens in both.
incorrect.E: "Database engine capacity" is incorrect. Specification, not cost input.

q: A business currently operates an on-premises Microsoft SQL Server instance and is transferring its application to AWS. Although the firm lacks the resources necessary to modify the program, management wants to cut operating costs as part of the move. Which database service is most capable of meeting these requirements?

options.C: Microsoft SQL Server on Amazon EC2

explanation: Amazon RDS for SQL Server is a managed service that handles backups, patching, and failover, reducing operational costs (administrative burden) compared to self-managed EC2, without requiring application code changes (unlike moving to DynamoDB).
correct: "Amazon RDS for SQL Server" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. Requires code changes (NoSQL).
incorrect.C: "Microsoft SQL Server on Amazon EC2" is incorrect. Higher operating cost (self-managed).

q: A development team wants to publish and manage web services that provide REST APIs. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon API Gateway is a fully managed service that makes it easy to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs.
correct: "Amazon API Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS App Mesh" is incorrect. Service mesh.
incorrect.D: "AWS Cloud Map" is incorrect. Service discovery.

q: What is an example of AWS Cloud agility?

options.C: Using Consolidated Billing to produce one bill
options.D: Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources

explanation: Agility refers to the ability to quickly provision resources, reducing the time to market.
correct: "Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Access to multiple instance types" is incorrect. Flexibility.
incorrect.B: "Access to managed services" is incorrect. Efficiency.
incorrect.C: "Using Consolidated Billing..." is incorrect. Cost management.

q: What are the advantages of using loose coupling as a design paradigm for cloud architectures?

options.B: It allows applications to have dependent workflows.
options.C: It prevents cascading failures between different components.
options.D: It allows companies to focus on their physical data center operations.

explanation: Loose coupling ensures that a failure in one component does not propagate to others, preventing cascading failures.
correct: "It prevents cascading failures between different components" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "It facilitates low-latency request handling" is incorrect. Often adds slight latency (queues).
incorrect.B: "It allows applications to have dependent workflows" is incorrect. It breaks dependencies.
incorrect.D: "It allows companies to focus on their physical data center operations" is incorrect.

q: A business operates a website that is hosted on AWS and is protected by an Application Load Balancer. The business wishes to protect its website against SQL injection and cross-site scripting. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service should the business use?
explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) protects against common web exploits like SQL injection and XSS.
correct: "AWS WAF" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Threat detection.

q: An online retail company wants to migrate its on-premises workload to AWS. The company needs to automatically handle a seasonal workload increase in a cost- effective manner. Which AWS Cloud features will help the company meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
explanation: Auto Scaling policies handle the workload increase automatically. Pay-as-you-go pricing ensures cost-effectiveness by only charging for resources when they are running.
correct: "Pay-as-you-go pricing" and "Auto Scaling policies" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Cross-Region workload deployment" is incorrect. For DR/Latency.
incorrect.C: "Built-in AWS CloudTrail audit capabilities" is incorrect. For auditing.
incorrect.E: "Centralized logging" is incorrect. For observability.

q: A company's recently released application is rapidly gaining popularity. To enhance customer service, the firm want to establish a phone number that would enable it to handle the growing amount of calls received by its support employees. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering should be utilized to fulfill this requirement?
explanation: Amazon Connect is an easy-to-use omnichannel cloud contact center service.
correct: "Amazon Connect" is the correct answer.

q: A business want to evaluate streaming user data and reply in real time to consumer enquiries. Which AWS service satisfies these criteria?
explanation: Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics is used to analyze and process streaming data in real time.
correct: "Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon QuickSight" is incorrect. BI.
incorrect.D: "AWS Data Pipeline" is incorrect. Batch data movement.

q: Which of the following is an example of a frequent IT duty that AWS can do in order to free up firm IT resources? (Select two.)
explanation: Managed services like RDS allow AWS to handle patching and backups (undifferentiated heavy lifting).
correct: "Patching databases software" and "Backing up databases" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Testing application releases" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Creating database schema" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.E: "Running penetration tests" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.

q: Which AWS service helps developers use loose coupling and reliable messaging between microservices?
explanation: Amazon SQS is a message queue service that enables loose coupling by buffering requests between components.
correct: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Elastic Load Balancing" is incorrect. Distributes traffic.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is incorrect. While it decouples via pub/sub, SQS is the primary *queue* based service for reliable messaging and buffering mentioned in standard decoupling patterns.

q: How should a web application be deployed in the AWS Cloud to guarantee high availability?

options.A: Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.
options.B: Deploy multiple instances of the application in a single Availability Zone.
options.C: Deploy the application to a compute-optimized Amazon EC2 instance in a single Availability Zone.
options.D: Deploy the application in one Amazon EC2 instance in an Auto Scaling group.

explanation: Deploying multiple instances across multiple Availability Zones ensures that if one AZ fails, the application remains available.
correct: "Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Deploy multiple instances... in a single Availability Zone" is incorrect. Single point of failure (the AZ).
incorrect.C: "Deploy the application... in a single Availability Zone" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "Deploy the application in one Amazon EC2 instance..." is incorrect. Single instance is a SPOF.

q: A company needs to implement identity management for a fleet of mobile apps that are running in the AWS Cloud. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon Cognito provides user identity and data synchronization services, making it easy to manage user data for mobile apps.
correct: "Amazon Cognito" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Security Hub" is incorrect. Security posture.

q: Which AWS service or feature enables a business to track, monitor, and control its AWS expenses and consumption over time?
explanation: AWS Cost Explorer is the tool used to track, monitor, and visualize costs over time.
correct: "AWS Cost Explorer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. Alerting based on thresholds.
incorrect.D: "Consolidated billing" is incorrect. Feature of Organizations for payment.

q: A huge corporation has recruited a developer who requires AWS credentials. Which security best practices should be adhered to? (Select two.)

options.A: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
options.B: Share the AWS account root user credentials with the developer.
options.C: Add the developer to the administrator's group in AWS IAM.
options.D: Configure a password policy that ensures the developer's password cannot be changed.
options.E: Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.

explanation: Granting least privilege (A) and enforcing strong password policies (E) are key security best practices.
correct: "Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job" and "Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Share the AWS account root user credentials..." is incorrect. Never share root.
incorrect.C: "Add the developer to the administrator's group..." is incorrect. Only if required; usually too broad.
incorrect.D: "Configure a password policy that ensures the developer's password cannot be changed" is incorrect. Users should rotate passwords.

q: A business has a 500 TB image repository that has to be moved to Amazon Web Services (AWS) for processing. Which AWS service is the most cost-effective way to import this data?
explanation: Transferring 500TB via network is slow and expensive. AWS Snowball is a physical data transport solution optimized for large data sets.
correct: "AWS Snowball" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Good for steady state, but Snowball is better for bulk one-time moves of this size.
incorrect.C: "AWS VPN" is incorrect. Too slow/unreliable for 500TB.
incorrect.D: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. S3 is the destination, not the transport method (uploading directly would be slow).

q: What is an AWS Cloud best practice in terms of design?
explanation: Designing for High Availability (often via removing single points of failure and loose coupling) is a core best practice.
correct: "High availability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Tight coupling..." is incorrect. Should be loose.
incorrect.B: "Single point of failure" is incorrect. Should be avoided.

q: A workload hosted on AWS will continue to operate indefinitely by using a steady number of Amazon EC2 instances. Which pricing strategy will decrease costs while assuring the availability of computational resources?
explanation: Reserved Instances offer discounts for steady-state usage over a 1 or 3 year term.
correct: "Reserved Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. Expensive.
incorrect.C: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Can be interrupted.

q: A company needs an Amazon EC2 instance for a rightsized database server that must run constantly for 1 year. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation: Standard Reserved Instances offer the highest discount level compared to Convertible RIs for steady usage.
correct: "Standard Reserved Instance" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Convertible Reserved Instance" is incorrect. Lower discount than Standard.
incorrect.D: "Spot Instance" is incorrect. Can be interrupted.

q: A company has multiple applications and is now building a new multi-tier application. The company will host the new application on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants the network routing and traffic between the various applications to follow the security principle of least privilege. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to enforce this principle?
explanation: Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances, allowing you to explicitly allow only necessary traffic (least privilege).
correct: "Security groups" is the correct answer.

incorrect.C: "AWS Global Accelerator" is incorrect. Traffic routing optimization.
incorrect.D: "AWS Direct Connect gateway" is incorrect. Connectivity.

q: A business is developing an application that will need the capacity to transmit, save, and receive messages across its components. Additionally, the corporation requires that communications be processed in first-in, first-out (FIFO) sequence. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service should the business use?
explanation: Amazon SQS supports FIFO queues, which ensure messages are processed in the exact order they are sent.
correct: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Step Functions" is incorrect. Workflow orchestration.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is incorrect. Pub/sub messaging (though SNS FIFO exists, SQS is the primary 'queue' for save/receive patterns).
incorrect.C: "Amazon Kinesis Data Streams" is incorrect. Streaming data.

q: A business requires 24/7 phone, email, and chat support, with a response time of less than one hour in the event of a service outage to a production system. Which AWS Support plan best matches these needs for the least amount of money?
explanation: The Business Support plan offers 24/7 access to support engineers and a < 1-hour response time for production system down events.
correct: "Business" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Basic" is incorrect. No tech support.
incorrect.D: "Enterprise" is incorrect. More expensive, offers < 15 min response for business-critical.

q: A customer is considering migrating an application burden to the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud. Which control becomes AWS's responsibility after the migration?

options.C: Protecting communications and maintaining zone security

explanation: AWS is responsible for the physical security of data centers (Security *of* the cloud).
correct: "Maintaining physical and environmental controls" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Patching the guest operating system" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Protecting communications..." is incorrect. Network configuration is largely customer responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Patching specific applications" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.

q: What is the function of a VPC's internet gateway?

options.A: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
options.B: To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet
options.C: To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
options.D: To load balance traffic from the Internet across Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: An internet gateway is a VPC component that allows communication between your VPC and the internet.
correct: "To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "To create a VPN connection..." is incorrect. Virtual Private Gateway.
incorrect.D: "To load balance traffic..." is incorrect. ELB.

q: Which AWS IAM feature enables developers to use the AWS CLI to access AWS services?
explanation: Access keys (Access Key ID and Secret Access Key) are the credentials used to authenticate programmatic requests via the AWS CLI and API.
correct: "Access keys" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "API keys" is incorrect. Used for API Gateway usage plans.
incorrect.C: "User names/Passwords" is incorrect. Used for Console access.
incorrect.D: "SSH keys" is incorrect. Used for EC2 login.

q: A company's web application requires AWS credentials and authorizations to use an AWS service. Which IAM entity should the company use as best practice?
explanation: IAM roles allow you to delegate permissions to resources for users and services without using permanent credentials (like user access keys). This is a best practice for applications running on EC2 or other AWS services.
correct: "IAM role" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "IAM user" is incorrect. Using IAM users with long-term credentials embedded in applications is not best practice.
incorrect.C: "IAM group" is incorrect. Groups are for organizing users.
incorrect.D: "IAM multi-factor authentication (MFA)" is incorrect. MFA is an authentication method, not an entity for authorization.

q: Which AWS service or feature gives a company the ability to control incoming traffic and outgoing traffic for Amazon EC2 instances?
explanation: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your EC2 instances to control incoming and outgoing traffic.
correct: "Security groups" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Route 53" is incorrect. This is a DNS service.
incorrect.C: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. This connects on-premises networks to AWS.
incorrect.D: "Amazon VPC" is incorrect. This is the networking environment, but Security Groups are the specific feature for instance traffic control.

q: On AWS, a corporation is constructing a new archiving system capable of storing terabytes of data. The firm will NOT often retrieve the data. Which Amazon S3 storage type will result in the LOWEST SYSTEM COST?

options.D: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)

explanation: Amazon S3 Glacier (specifically Glacier Deep Archive) is the lowest cost storage class for data archiving where data is rarely retrieved.
correct: "S3 Glacier" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "S3 Standard-Infrequent Access" is incorrect. More expensive than Glacier.
incorrect.C: "S3 Intelligent-Tiering" is incorrect. Designed for unknown access patterns, includes monitoring fee.
incorrect.D: "S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access" is incorrect. More expensive than Glacier.

q: Which AWS Support package includes access to architectural and operational assessments, as well as 24/7 email, online chat, and phone support from Senior Cloud Support Engineers?
explanation: Enterprise Support includes consultative architectural guidance (like Well-Architected Reviews) and operational assessments, along with 24/7 access to Senior Cloud Support Engineers.
correct: "Enterprise" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Basic" is incorrect. No tech support.
incorrect.B: "Business" is incorrect. Has 24/7 support but not the architectural/operational assessments of Enterprise.
incorrect.C: "Developer" is incorrect. Business hours email access only.

q: Which of the following describes the root user of an AWS account?

options.A: The root user is the only user that can be configured with multi-factor authentication (MFA).
options.B: The root user is the only user that can access the AWS Management Console.
options.C: The root user is the first sign-in identity that is available when an AWS account is created.
options.D: The root user has a password that cannot be changed.

explanation: The root user is the identity created when you first create your AWS account and has complete access to all AWS services and resources in the account.
correct: "The root user is the first sign-in identity that is available when an AWS account is created" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "The root user is the only user that can be configured with... MFA" is incorrect. IAM users can also use MFA.
incorrect.B: "The root user is the only user that can access the... Console" is incorrect. IAM users can access the console.
incorrect.D: "The root user has a password that cannot be changed" is incorrect. You can change the root password.

q: The AWS IAM recommended practice for providing the fewest possible privileges is as follows:

options.A: apply an IAM policy to an IAM group and limit the size of the group.
options.B: require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all IAM users.
options.C: require each IAM user who has different permissions to have multiple passwords.
options.D: apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it.

explanation: Granting least privilege involves defining permissions for specific tasks and applying them only to the identities (users/roles) that require them.
correct: "apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "apply an IAM policy to an IAM group..." is incorrect. While groups are good, limiting group size isn't the definition of least privilege.
incorrect.B: "require multi-factor authentication..." is incorrect. This is a security best practice but not the definition of 'fewest possible privileges'.
incorrect.C: "require each IAM user... multiple passwords" is incorrect.

q: To prevent fraudulent compute activity, a user need a simple method to detect whether any Amazon EC2 instances have unlimited access to their ports. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering will meet this requirement?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "VPC Flow Logs" is incorrect. Captures traffic, doesn't audit configuration rules easily.

q: Which AWS service is a content delivery network that safely and quickly distributes data, video, and apps to consumers worldwide?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudFormation" is incorrect. IaC service.
incorrect.B: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Networking service.

q: A company is starting to build its infrastructure in the AWS Cloud. The company wants access to technical support during business hours. The company also wants general architectural guidance as teams build and test new applications. Which AWS Support plan will meet these requirements at the LOWEST cost?
explanation: The Developer Support plan offers business hours email access to Cloud Support Associates and general architectural guidance.
correct: "AWS Developer Support" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Basic Support" is incorrect. No technical support.
incorrect.C: "AWS Business Support" is incorrect. 24/7 support (more expensive).
incorrect.D: "AWS Enterprise Support" is incorrect. Most expensive.

q: A company is migrating its public website to AWS. The company wants to host the domain name for the website on AWS. Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) web service that offers domain registration.
correct: "Amazon Route 53" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Lambda" is incorrect. Compute.

q: A company needs to evaluate its AWS environment and provide best practice recommendations in five categories: cost, performance, service limits, fault tolerance, and security. Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor evaluates your account by using checks in five categories: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. DDoS protection.
incorrect.D: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect. IT service management.

q: Which AWS feature is exemplified by on-demand technology services that allow businesses to substitute variable expenditures for upfront fixed expenses?
explanation: Pay-as-you-go pricing allows businesses to trade capital expense (fixed) for variable expense (operational).
correct: "Pay-as-you-go pricing" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "High availability" is incorrect.

q: A business is relocating and need an encrypted connection to AWS. Which AWS service will assist you in fulfilling this requirement?
explanation: AWS VPN provides an encrypted connection (IPsec) between your network and your AWS VPCs.
correct: "AWS VPN" is the correct answer.

incorrect.C: "Amazon API Gateway" is incorrect. API management.

q: What technology permits compute capacity to alter in response to changing load conditions?
explanation: Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost.
correct: "Auto Scaling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Load balancing" is incorrect. Distributes traffic.
incorrect.B: "Automatic failover" is incorrect. Switches to standby on failure.

q: Which AWS service provides the capability to view end-to-end performance metrics and troubleshoot distributed applications?
explanation: AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug production, distributed applications, enabling end-to-end tracing and troubleshooting.
correct: "AWS X-Ray" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Cloud9" is incorrect. IDE.
incorrect.C: "AWS Cloud Map" is incorrect. Service discovery.

q: A major corporation has a workload that demands on-premises hardware. The organization want to continue using the same management and control plane services as it does on AWS. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering should the business employ to achieve these requirements?
explanation: AWS Outposts is a fully managed service that offers the same AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to virtually any datacenter, co-location space, or on-premises facility.
correct: "AWS Outposts" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Device Farm" is incorrect. Mobile app testing.
incorrect.D: "AWS Ground Station" is incorrect. Satellite control.

q: A business operates an ecommerce application that is hosted in Europe. To reduce latency for international customers accessing the website, the firm would want to cache frequently viewed static information closer to the consumers. Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering will meet these requirements?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a global Content Delivery Network (CDN) that caches content at Edge Locations close to users to reduce latency.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon ElastiCache" is incorrect. In-memory data store (backend caching), not for global content distribution.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. File storage.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. Block storage.

q: Which of the following is not a recommended approach for IAM user management? (Select two.)

options.A: Require IAM users to change their passwords after a specified period of time
options.B: Prevent IAM users from reusing previous passwords
options.C: Recommend that the same password be used on AWS and other sites
options.D: Require IAM users to store their passwords in raw text
options.E: Disable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for IAM users

explanation: Security best practices recommend strong passwords, rotation, and MFA. Storing passwords in raw text and disabling MFA are NOT recommended.
correct: "Require IAM users to store their passwords in raw text" and "Disable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for IAM users" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Require IAM users to change their passwords..." is incorrect. This IS recommended (rotation).
incorrect.B: "Prevent IAM users from reusing..." is incorrect. This IS recommended.
incorrect.C: "Recommend that the same password be used..." is incorrect. This is also NOT recommended, but the source key selected D and E as the answers.

q: Which Amazon Web Services feature assists in identifying harmful or illegal activity in AWS accounts and workloads?
explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior.
correct: "Amazon GuardDuty" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Rekognition" is incorrect. Image analysis.
incorrect.B: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Resource optimization.

q: Which AWS service or functionality provides technical support to users who subscribe to the AWS Basic Support plan?
explanation: Basic Support includes access to core Trusted Advisor checks and documentation/forums. It does not include 24/7 technical support from engineers or a TAM.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS senior support engineers" is incorrect. Requires Enterprise support.
incorrect.B: "AWS technical account manager (TAM)" is incorrect. Requires Enterprise support.
incorrect.D: "AWS Discussion Forums" is incorrect. While available, Trusted Advisor is the functionality/service that provides *guidance* (technical support in the form of automated checks) mentioned in the source context.

q: Which AWS service provides threat detection by monitoring for malicious activities and unauthorized actions to protect AWS accounts, workloads, and data that is stored in Amazon S3?
explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors your AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity.
correct: "Amazon GuardDuty" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. DDoS protection.
incorrect.B: "AWS Firewall Manager" is incorrect. Firewall management.

q: Which AWS service enables you to get AWS security and compliance information on-demand?
explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudTrail" is incorrect. API auditing.

q: Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service makes use of edge locations?
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator and Amazon CloudFront use the AWS global network of edge locations.
correct: "AWS Global Accelerator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Aurora" is incorrect. Regional DB.

q: Which of the following AWS capabilities allows a user to deploy an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance that has already been configured?
explanation: An Amazon Machine Image (AMI) provides the information required to launch an instance, including the operating system and installed software.
correct: "Amazon Machine Image" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. Storage volume.
incorrect.C: "Amazon EC2 Systems Manager" is incorrect. Management tool.

q: Which AWS service can a company use to store and manage Docker images?
explanation: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) is a fully managed Docker container registry that makes it easy to store, share, and deploy container images.
correct: "Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. Database.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Kinesis Data Streams" is incorrect. Streaming data.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)" is incorrect. File storage.

q: A business wishes to send its traffic directly and confidentially to a virtual private cloud (VPC) rather than through the public internet. Which mode of connection enables this capability?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location, bypassing the internet.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS VPN" is incorrect. Uses the internet (encrypted tunnel).
incorrect.C: "VPC NAT gateway" is incorrect. For outbound internet access.
incorrect.D: "VPC internet gateway" is incorrect. For public internet access.

q: What can be utilized to automate and manage AWS setups that are safe, well-architected, and multi-account?
explanation: AWS Control Tower automates the set-up of a baseline environment, or landing zone, that is a secure, well-architected multi-account AWS environment.
correct: "AWS Control Tower" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS shared responsibility model" is incorrect. Concept.
incorrect.C: "AWS Security Hub" is incorrect. Security posture.
incorrect.D: "AWS Well-Architected Tool" is incorrect. Review tool.

q: A company needs an automated security assessment report that will identify unintended network access to Amazon EC2 instances. The report also must identify operating system vulnerabilities on those instances. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated vulnerability management service that continually scans AWS workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.
correct: "Amazon Inspector" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Checks service limits/best practices.

q: Which AWS Support plan is the LEAST EXPENSIVE that provides for a one-hour goal response time for support cases?
explanation: The Business Support plan offers a < 1-hour response time for production system down cases. Enterprise offers < 15 min for business-critical system down, but Business is cheaper.
correct: "Business" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Enterprise" is incorrect. More expensive.
incorrect.C: "Developer" is incorrect. Business hours only, slower response.

q: Which AWS hybrid storage offering allows users to effortlessly integrate on-premises applications with AWS Cloud storage?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage.
correct: "AWS Storage Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Backup" is incorrect. Backup service.

q: A user needs to prepare a report that summarizes the status of AWS account's major security checks. The report must contain the following: Permissions on Amazon S3 buckets are now inactive. Whether or not multi-factor authentication is enabled for the root user of the AWS account. If any security groups are set to enable unlimited access, this will be shown. Where can I get all of this information in one place?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides checks for security, including S3 bucket permissions, MFA on root account, and security group ports.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor report" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon QuickSight dashboard" is incorrect. BI tool.
incorrect.B: "AWS CloudTrail trails" is incorrect. Audit logs.
incorrect.D: "IAM credential report" is incorrect. User credentials only.

q: A pharmaceutical company's infrastructure is managed in a single AWS Region. The organization want to link hundreds of VPCs across many AWS accounts. Which AWS service or feature should the business use to streamline administration and save operating costs?
explanation: AWS Transit Gateway connects VPCs and on-premises networks through a central hub, simplifying the network topology and administration for hundreds of VPCs.
correct: "AWS Transit Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "VPC endpoint" is incorrect. Private service access.
incorrect.B: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. On-prem connectivity.
incorrect.D: "VPC peering" is incorrect. Does not scale well (mesh) for hundreds of VPCs.

q: A global company is building a simple time-tracking mobile app. The app needs to operate globally and must store collected data in a database. Data must be accessible from the AWS Region that is closest to the user. What should the company do to meet these data storage requirements with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?

options.A: Use Amazon EC2 in multiple Regions to host separate databases
options.D: Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)

explanation: Amazon DynamoDB Global Tables replicates your DynamoDB tables automatically across your choice of AWS Regions, providing multi-region, multi-active database capabilities.
correct: "Use Amazon DynamoDB global tables" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Use Amazon EC2..." is incorrect. High overhead.
incorrect.B: "Use Amazon RDS cross-Region replication" is incorrect. Read replicas are read-only in secondary regions.
incorrect.D: "Use AWS Database Migration Service" is incorrect. Migration tool.

q: One advantage of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) on demand pricing is the following:

options.A: the ability to bid for a lower hourly cost.
options.B: paying a daily rate regardless of time used.
options.D: pre-paying for instances and paying a lower hourly rate.

explanation: On-Demand instances allow you to pay for compute capacity by the hour or second (minimum of 60 seconds) with no long-term commitment.
correct: "paying only for time used" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "the ability to bid..." is incorrect. Spot instances.
incorrect.D: "pre-paying for instances..." is incorrect. Reserved Instances.

q: Which task is a customer's responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Management of the guest operating systems
options.B: Maintenance of the configuration of infrastructure devices
options.C: Management of the host operating systems and virtualization
options.D: Maintenance of the software that powers Availability Zones

explanation: The customer is responsible for managing the guest operating system (including updates and security patches).
correct: "Management of the guest operating systems" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Maintenance of the configuration of infrastructure devices" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Management of the host operating systems..." is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Maintenance of the software..." is incorrect. AWS responsibility.

q: Which AWS service enables you to swiftly conduct one-time queries on Amazon S3 data?
explanation: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL.
correct: "Amazon Athena" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EMR" is incorrect. Big data processing (Hadoop).

q: A company needs to deliver new website features quickly in an iterative manner to minimize the time to market. Which AWS Cloud concept does this requirement represent?
explanation: Agility refers to the ability to rapidly develop, test, and launch applications that drive business growth.
correct: "Agility" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Reliability" is incorrect.

q: Which VPC component adds an additional layer of protection to the subnet?
explanation: Network Access Control Lists (NACLs) provide a stateless firewall at the subnet level.
correct: "Network ACLs" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Security groups" is incorrect. Instance level.
incorrect.C: "NAT gateways" is incorrect. Outbound internet access.

q: A company wants to increase its ability to recover its infrastructure in the case of a natural disaster. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this ability represent?
explanation: Reliability includes the ability to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions.
correct: "Reliability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Cost optimization" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS Support package is the LEAST EXPENSIVE that includes a dedicated AWS technical account manager (TAM)?
explanation: The Enterprise Support plan is the only plan that includes a designated Technical Account Manager (TAM).
correct: "AWS Enterprise Support" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Developer Support" is incorrect.

q: Which tool is suitable for monitoring Amazon Web Services service limits?

options.A: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks for service limits (quotas) usage and alerts if you are close to reaching them.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "AWS Cost and Usage report" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service or functionality involves the implementation of an internet service provider (ISP) and a colocation facility?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location (colocation facility) via a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS VPN" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service tracks API calls and user activity?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs API calls made on your account, enabling you to track user activity.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Organizations" is incorrect.

q: Which cloud architectural design concepts are advised for re-architecting a huge monolithic application? (Select two.)
explanation: Loose coupling and scalability are key principles when moving from monolithic to microservices architectures.
correct: "Implement loose coupling" and "Design for scalability" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Use manual monitoring" is incorrect. Use automated monitoring.
incorrect.B: "Use fixed servers" is incorrect. Use elastic resources.
incorrect.D: "Rely on individual components" is incorrect. Design for failure.

q: Which Reserved Instance (RI) provides the HIGHEST average cost savings compared to an On-Demand Instance?
explanation: The longer the term (3 years) and the more you pay upfront (All Upfront), and the less flexible the type (Standard vs Convertible), the higher the discount.
correct: "3-year, All Upfront, Standard RI" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "1-year, No Upfront, Standard RI" is incorrect. Lower discount.
incorrect.B: "1-year, All Upfront, Convertible RI" is incorrect. Lower discount.
incorrect.D: "3-year, No Upfront, Convertible RI" is incorrect. Lower discount.

q: A business must monitor its AWS accounts and determine when an API request is performed against its AWS resources. Which AWS product or service is most appropriate for meeting these requirements?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls made on your account.
correct: "AWS Cloud Trail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon CloudWatch" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service, feature, or tool uses machine learning to continuously monitor cost and usage for unusual cloud spending?
explanation: AWS Cost Anomaly Detection uses machine learning to identify anomalous spend and root causes.
correct: "AWS Cost Anomaly Detection" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Lookout for Metrics" is incorrect. General metrics anomaly detection.

q: Which AWS Cloud feature will enable a multinational corporation to meet its demand for low latency to all of its customers?
explanation: Global reach allows you to deploy applications in regions around the world, reducing latency for local users.
correct: "Global reach" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Fault tolerance" is incorrect.

q: A business currently operates in one AWS Region and is extending operations to a second. In the second Region, the organization is utilizing the identical AWS CloudFormation template as in the original Region. When the organization seeks to deploy Amazon EC2 On-Demand Instances in the second Region, it encounters errors. What might possibly be the source of these error messages?

options.A: A new EC2 key pair has not been created for the EC2 instances.
options.B: The requested EC2 instance types are not available in the second Region.
options.C: The company cannot operate in a second Region until it updates its AWS contract.
options.D: The company has not configured AWS Budgets to monitor the budget for the EC2 instances.

explanation: Key pairs are regional resources. A key pair created in one region does not automatically exist in another region. The CloudFormation template likely references the key pair name, which doesn't exist in the new region.
correct: "A new EC2 key pair has not been created for the EC2 instances." is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "The requested EC2 instance types are not available..." is incorrect. While possible, the key pair issue is a more common configuration error when replicating templates.
incorrect.C: "The company cannot operate in a second Region..." is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "The company has not configured AWS Budgets..." is incorrect.

q: Which principles are used while architecting apps for AWS Cloud reliability? (Select two.)

options.D: Test for moderate demand to ensure reliability
options.E: Backup recovery to an on-premises environment

explanation: Designing for automated failure recovery and using multiple Availability Zones (to mitigate single AZ failures) are key principles of reliability.
correct: "Design for automated failure recovery" and "Use multiple Availability Zones" are the correct answers.

incorrect.C: "Manage changes via documented processes" is incorrect. Should use automation.
incorrect.D: "Test for moderate demand..." is incorrect. Should test for scale.
incorrect.E: "Backup recovery to an on-premises environment" is incorrect. Usually backup TO the cloud.

q: Which of the following are Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) components? (Select two.)
explanation: Subnets and Internet Gateways are core components of the Amazon VPC architecture.
correct: "Subnets" and "Internet gateways" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Access policies" is incorrect. While policies exist (e.g., IAM, S3 bucket policies), 'Access policies' generally refers to IAM or S3, not a distinct 'VPC component' like a subnet.
incorrect.C: "Objects" is incorrect. Objects are S3 components.
incorrect.E: "Buckets" is incorrect. Buckets are S3 components.

q: Which AWS service monitors the status of AWS services and alerts consumers when certain events may affect them?
explanation: The AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides alerts and remediation guidance when AWS is experiencing events that may impact *you* specifically.
correct: "AWS Personal Health Dashboard" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Recommendations.
incorrect.C: "AWS Service Health Dashboard" is incorrect. General status of all services (not personalized alerting).

q: Which option is a customer responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Physical security of the data center

explanation: Configuring security groups (firewalls) is a customer responsibility (Security *in* the cloud).
correct: "Configuration of security groups" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Physical security of the data center" is incorrect. AWS Responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Replacement of faulty hard drives" is incorrect. AWS Responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Firmware updates on network infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS Responsibility.

q: What functionality does the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling feature provide?

options.A: It automatically closes unused EC2 instances.
options.B: It performs a health check on each EC2 instance and effectively routes traffic to healthy instances.
options.C: It scales the number of EC2 instances out and in, based on demand.
options.D: It distributes traffic across multiple EC2 instances in different Availability Zones.

explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling ensures you have the correct number of Amazon EC2 instances available to handle the load for your application.
correct: "It scales the number of EC2 instances out and in, based on demand" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "It automatically closes unused EC2 instances" is incorrect. (Partially true, but 'unused' is vague; it terminates based on *scaling policies*).
incorrect.B: "It performs a health check... routes traffic" is incorrect. This describes Elastic Load Balancing (ELB).
incorrect.D: "It distributes traffic..." is incorrect. This describes ELB.

q: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework places a premium on the ability to operate and monitor systems efficiently in order to provide business value?
explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar focuses on running and monitoring systems to deliver business value, and continually improving processes and procedures.
correct: "Operational excellence" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Cost optimization" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service or feature allows a business to restrict access to an Amazon S3 bucket to just particular users?
explanation: Bucket policies are resource-based policies that you can use to grant access permissions to your bucket and the objects in it.
correct: "S3 bucket policies" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Vulnerability scanner.
incorrect.B: "AWS Bucket Shield" is incorrect. Not a real service.

q: What are the economic advantages of adopting the AWS Cloud? (Select two.)
explanation: Consumption-based pricing (pay-as-you-go) and economies of scale (lower costs due to aggregation) are key economic benefits.
correct: "Consumption-based pricing" and "Economies of scale" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Perpetual licenses" is incorrect. Cloud usually uses subscription/usage models.
incorrect.E: "Custom hardware acquisition" is incorrect. AWS manages hardware.

q: Which task is the customer's obligation under the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Customers are responsible for classifying their assets and using IAM tools to apply appropriate permissions.
correct: "Classifying company assets" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Managing the network infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.B: "Maintaining the physical hardware" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Securing the virtualization layer" is incorrect. AWS responsibility.

q: Which task is the responsibility of AWS when using AWS Lambda?

options.A: Management of the underlying operating system

explanation: AWS Lambda is a managed service; AWS manages the underlying infrastructure and operating system.
correct: "Management of the underlying operating system" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Creation of the Lambda function" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.C: "Management of the application code" is incorrect. Customer responsibility.
incorrect.D: "Installation of application dependencies" is incorrect. Customer responsibility (packaged with code).

q: What AWS tool or feature allows users to troubleshoot connectivity issues between two subnets?
explanation: VPC Reachability Analyzer is a configuration analysis tool that enables you to perform connectivity testing between a source resource and a destination resource in your virtual private clouds (VPCs).
correct: "VPC Reachability Analyzer" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Network Firewall" is incorrect. Protection service.
incorrect.B: "AWS Systems Manager Session Manager" is incorrect. Instance access.
incorrect.C: "VPC Flow Logs" is incorrect. Traffic logging (useful for analysis but Analyzer specifically tests *reachability* logic).

q: Which Amazon EC2 pricing option is best suited for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted?
explanation: On-Demand instances are ideal for short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted.
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Interruptible.

q: What is the most straightforward approach for a business to manage payment for AWS charges incurred by many AWS accounts?

options.A: Use the consolidated billing feature in AWS Organizations.
options.B: Contact AWS Support to request a combined bill.
options.D: Use the AWS Billing Dashboard to merge the bills.

explanation: Consolidated billing in AWS Organizations is the standard method to combine bills.
correct: "Use the consolidated billing feature in AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Contact AWS Support..." is incorrect. Self-service feature.
incorrect.C: "Use a third-party payment provider" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "Use the AWS Billing Dashboard to merge..." is incorrect. Dashboard shows info, Organizations *enables* the merging.

q: Which design principle supports the reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

options.C: Scale horizontally to increase aggregate workload availability.

explanation: Replacing one large resource with multiple small resources (horizontal scaling) reduces the impact of a single failure, increasing reliability.
correct: "Scale horizontally to increase aggregate workload availability" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Perform operations as code" is incorrect. Operational Excellence.
incorrect.D: "Implement a strong identity foundation" is incorrect. Security.

q: Which AWS service offers a feature that inspects Amazon CloudFront distributions for compliance with security best practices?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks your CloudFront configuration to ensure it is following best practices (e.g., using SSL, logging enabled).
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. DDoS protection.

q: What is a feature of Amazon Route 53?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 includes domain registration capabilities.
correct: "Domain registration" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Offloading content..." is incorrect. CloudFront.
incorrect.B: "Load balancing..." is incorrect. ELB (though Route 53 *routes* traffic, ELB balances it).

q: Which AWS service facilitates the centralized management of AWS access across many accounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations enables centralized management of access policies (SCPs) across multiple accounts.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect.

q: What is the most effective way for a user to secure an Amazon S3 bucket?
explanation: Bucket policies are the primary mechanism for controlling access to S3 buckets.
correct: "Use S3 bucket policies" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Use AWS WAF" is incorrect. Web application firewall.
incorrect.B: "Use AWS Shield" is incorrect. DDoS protection.
incorrect.C: "Use Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Threat detection.

q: Which AWS service simplifies the creation and management of virtual desktops?
explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces is a fully managed desktop virtualization service (DaaS).
correct: "Amazon WorkSpaces" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. Storage.

q: A company wants to use Amazon EC2 to host a web application. The application must be available to users worldwide. The company wants to ensure that the application is available with low latency. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator improves availability and performance of your applications with local or global users by routing traffic through the AWS global network infrastructure. (Note: CloudFront is for caching content. Global Accelerator is often preferred for non-HTTP protocols or dynamic applications needing static IPs and global routing optimization, though CloudFront handles web apps well. Given the options, Global Accelerator is a strong candidate for 'low latency availability' of the *application* itself). However, looking at typical CP questions, CloudFront (A) is often the answer for 'web application worldwide low latency'. Let's check the source context if possible. Usually for general web app content, CloudFront. For gaming/UDP/non-HTTP, Global Accelerator. Without specific content type, CloudFront is the standard 'CDN' answer. But Global Accelerator routes to the optimal endpoint.
correct: "AWS Global Accelerator" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon CloudFront" is incorrect (in this specific source context, likely prioritizing GA for application routing over content caching).
incorrect.C: "Amazon Route 53 latency-based routing" is incorrect. DNS based, slower failover than GA.

q: Which AWS service gives users the ability to categorize and track AWS costs?
explanation: Cost allocation tags allow you to categorize and track your AWS costs on a detailed level.
correct: "Cost allocation tags" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Service Catalog" is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "AWS Cost and Usage Report" is incorrect. While it *reports* costs, tags are the *ability* to categorize them.

q: Which service provides a hybrid cloud storage solution?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service.
correct: "AWS Storage Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. Cloud archive.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)" is incorrect. Cloud block storage.

q: A business intends to create a hybrid cloud architecture. Which AWS service provides a dedicated connection between the company's on-premises network and the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated network connection.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS Support plan includes the full set of AWS Trusted Advisor checks?
explanation: Business and Enterprise Support plans include access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.
correct: "Business Support" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Basic Support" is incorrect. Core checks only.
incorrect.B: "Developer Support" is incorrect. Core checks only.

q: A company needs to run a scheduled task once every Friday. The task runs for 30 minutes and cannot be interrupted. Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing option meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation: Scheduled Reserved Instances allow you to reserve capacity for your instances in specific time windows (e.g., every Friday). Note: Scheduled RIs are a legacy offering but often appear in exam dumps. If not available, On-Demand might be the next best practical choice, but Scheduled RI is the 'textbook' answer for this recurring scheduled pattern if presented.
correct: "Scheduled Reserved Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect. More expensive than Reserved if available.
incorrect.C: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. Cannot be interrupted.

q: Which AWS service or tool allows users to create a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud?
explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud.
correct: "Amazon VPC" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Connectivity.

q: Which AWS Cloud benefit is demonstrated by the ability to deploy an application in multiple Regions worldwide?
explanation: Global reach refers to the ability to deploy applications in multiple regions around the world.
correct: "Global reach" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Elasticity" is incorrect.

q: Which Amazon Web Services (AWS) service should a business use to identify performance bottlenecks in its application code?
explanation: AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug applications, identifying performance bottlenecks.
correct: "AWS X-Ray" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service is appropriate for processing massive quantities of data using the Hadoop framework?
explanation: Amazon EMR (Elastic MapReduce) provides a managed Hadoop framework.
correct: "Amazon EMR" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Athena" is incorrect. SQL queries.

q: Which of the following describes a security best practice that can be implemented by using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)?

options.B: Grant permissions to users who are required to perform a specific task.
options.C: Generate new credentials for every request.
options.D: Share AWS account root user credentials with all administrators.

explanation: Granting permissions only to users who require them (Least Privilege) is a core IAM best practice.
correct: "Grant permissions to users who are required to perform a specific task" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Disable AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)" is incorrect. Should enable it.
incorrect.C: "Generate new credentials for every request" is incorrect. Impractical.
incorrect.D: "Share AWS account root user credentials..." is incorrect. Never share root.

q: Which AWS service or feature allows for the establishment of a private network connection between a customer's on-premises environment and the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network connection.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

incorrect.D: "AWS Transit Gateway" is incorrect. Network hub (can use DC, but DC is the *connection* itself).

q: A company wants to migrate its on-premises database to AWS. The database needs to support complex queries and joins. Which AWS service should the company use?
explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) supports relational databases which are designed for complex queries and joins.
correct: "Amazon RDS" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. NoSQL (not optimized for complex joins).

q: Which service provides an on-demand, scalable computing capacity?
explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud.
correct: "Amazon EC2" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. Storage.

q: Which AWS service should be used to create a billing alarm?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch allows you to create billing alarms to monitor your estimated AWS charges.
correct: "Amazon CloudWatch" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect.

q: What is the value of using AWS CloudFormation?

options.A: It allows users to create and manage a collection of related AWS resources.
options.B: It provides a template for creating an AWS account.
options.C: It automates the translation of code for applications.
options.D: It provides detailed cost estimates for AWS resources.

explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to model a collection of related AWS and third-party resources, provision them quickly and consistently, and manage them throughout their lifecycles.
correct: "It allows users to create and manage a collection of related AWS resources." is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "It provides a template for creating an AWS account" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "It automates the translation of code..." is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "It provides detailed cost estimates..." is incorrect.

q: Which pricing model provides the greatest discount for Amazon EC2 instances?
explanation: Spot Instances offer the steepest discounts (up to 90%) compared to On-Demand prices.
correct: "Spot Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "On-Demand Instances" is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. Discounts up to 72%.

q: Which of the following is a managed service that provides a relational database?
explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) is a managed service for relational databases.
correct: "Amazon RDS" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect. NoSQL.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect. Data warehouse (relational, but 'RDS' is the primary relational database service answer).

q: Which AWS service helps customers meet corporate compliance requirements?
explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to security and compliance reports to help meet requirements.
correct: "AWS Artifact" is the correct answer.

q: Which of the following services is an AWS compute service?
explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service.
correct: "AWS Lambda" is the correct answer.

q: A company wants to store data in a durable, scalable, and secure way. Which AWS service should the company use?
explanation: Amazon S3 provides durable, scalable, and secure object storage.
correct: "Amazon S3" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon EC2" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service provides a simple and scalable shared file storage solution for use with Linux-based Amazon EC2 instances?
explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) provides a simple, scalable, fully managed elastic NFS file system for use with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources.
correct: "Amazon EFS" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3" is incorrect. Object storage.

q: Which feature allows you to launch a fleet of Spot Instances that is distributed across multiple Availability Zones?
explanation: A Spot Fleet is a collection of Spot Instances and optionally On-Demand Instances. It attempts to launch the number of Spot Instances that are required to meet the target capacity you specified.
correct: "Spot Fleet" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Auto Scaling group" is incorrect. (Though ASGs can also launch Spot, Spot Fleet is the specific feature name for a fleet of Spot instances often referenced in older exam contexts, though ASG is preferred now. Source likely targets A).

q: Which AWS service provides a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account?
explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) is a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account.
correct: "Amazon VPC" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service can be used to send email notifications?
explanation: Amazon SES (Simple Email Service) is a cloud-based email sending service.
correct: "Amazon SES" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon SNS" is incorrect. Sends notifications (can be email, but SES is *the* email service).

q: Which support plan provides access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks?
explanation: Business and Enterprise plans provide full Trusted Advisor checks.
correct: "Business" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Basic" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service can be used to host a static website?
explanation: Amazon S3 can be used to host static websites.
correct: "Amazon S3" is the correct answer.

q: Which of the following allows you to create a private connection between your VPC and another VPC?
explanation: VPC Peering allows you to connect two VPCs.
correct: "VPC Peering" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service is used to manage identities and access to AWS resources?
explanation: AWS IAM (Identity and Access Management) is used to manage access to AWS resources.
correct: "AWS IAM" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service can be used to track user activity and API usage?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail tracks user activity and API usage.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service allows you to decouple the components of an application?
explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) allows you to decouple application components.
correct: "Amazon SQS" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service allows you to distribute content to users with low latency?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that distributes content with low latency.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service provides a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service that safeguards applications running on AWS?
explanation: AWS Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service that safeguards applications running on AWS. AWS Shield Standard is automatically enabled for all AWS customers at no additional cost.
correct: "AWS Shield" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications or APIs against common web exploits.
incorrect.B: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS.
incorrect.D: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior.

q: Which of the following is a benefit of using AWS Global Accelerator?

options.A: It caches content at edge locations to improve read performance.
options.B: It provides a static IP address that acts as a fixed entry point to your application.
options.C: It automatically scales your application in response to demand.
options.D: It provides a private network connection from your premises to AWS.

explanation: AWS Global Accelerator provides two static IP addresses that act as a fixed entry point to your application endpoints, such as Application Load Balancers, Network Load Balancers, or Amazon EC2 instances.
correct: "It provides a static IP address that acts as a fixed entry point to your application" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "It caches content at edge locations..." is incorrect. This describes Amazon CloudFront.
incorrect.C: "It automatically scales your application..." is incorrect. This describes AWS Auto Scaling.
incorrect.D: "It provides a private network connection..." is incorrect. This describes AWS Direct Connect.

q: A company wants to ensure that its AWS account activity is recorded for auditing and compliance purposes. Which AWS service should the company use?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail enables governance, compliance, operational auditing, and risk auditing of your AWS account. It records actions taken by a user, role, or an AWS service as events.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect. AWS Config tracks resource configuration changes, not API activity logs for auditing user actions.
incorrect.C: "Amazon CloudWatch" is incorrect. CloudWatch monitors performance metrics and logs, but CloudTrail is specifically for API audit logging.
incorrect.D: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect. Trusted Advisor provides recommendations for optimization.

q: Which AWS service allows you to send text messages (SMS) to mobile numbers?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) is a fully managed messaging service for both application-to-application (A2A) and application-to-person (A2P) communication. It supports sending SMS messages.
correct: "Amazon SNS" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon SES" is incorrect. Amazon Simple Email Service is for sending emails.
incorrect.C: "Amazon SQS" is incorrect. Amazon Simple Queue Service is for message queuing between software components.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. Amazon Connect is a contact center service.

q: A company wants to migrate its on-premises Oracle database to Amazon Aurora with minimal downtime. Which AWS service should the company use?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) helps you migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely. The source database remains fully operational during the migration, minimizing downtime.
correct: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Schema Conversion Tool (SCT)" is incorrect. SCT converts the database schema but does not perform the live data migration itself.
incorrect.C: "AWS DataSync" is incorrect. DataSync is for moving files and object data, not database migration.
incorrect.D: "AWS Snowball" is incorrect. Snowball is for large-scale offline data transfer.

q: Which AWS service provides a unified user interface so you can view operational data from multiple AWS services and allows you to automate operational tasks?
explanation: AWS Systems Manager provides a unified user interface so you can view operational data from multiple AWS services and allows you to automate operational tasks across your AWS resources.
correct: "AWS Systems Manager" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS OpsWorks" is incorrect. OpsWorks is a configuration management service that uses Chef and Puppet.
incorrect.C: "AWS CloudFormation" is incorrect. CloudFormation is for infrastructure as code.
incorrect.D: "AWS Config" is incorrect. AWS Config is for resource inventory and compliance.

q: Which of the following is a benefit of using Edge Locations in AWS?

options.A: They provide a central location for all AWS resources.
options.B: They improve application performance by caching content closer to users.
options.C: They provide a backup of your data in a different region.
options.D: They allow you to run applications in a disconnected environment.

explanation: Edge Locations are part of the AWS Global Infrastructure and are used by services like Amazon CloudFront to cache content closer to end-users, thereby reducing latency and improving performance.
correct: "They improve application performance by caching content closer to users" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "They provide a central location..." is incorrect. AWS has multiple Regions, not a single central location.
incorrect.C: "They provide a backup of your data..." is incorrect. This describes Cross-Region Replication.
incorrect.D: "They allow you to run applications in a disconnected environment" is incorrect. This describes services like AWS Snowball Edge.

q: A company needs to ensure that its Amazon S3 buckets are not publicly accessible. Which AWS feature can help verify this?
explanation: Amazon S3 Block Public Access provides controls across an entire AWS Account or at the individual bucket level to ensuring that objects are never publicly accessible.
correct: "S3 Block Public Access" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. WAF protects web applications, not S3 bucket permissions directly.
incorrect.C: "Security Groups" is incorrect. Security Groups control traffic to EC2 instances, not S3 buckets.
incorrect.D: "Network ACLs" is incorrect. Network ACLs control traffic at the subnet level.

q: Which AWS service should a developer use to integrate a chat feature into a mobile application with offline data synchronization capabilities?
explanation: AWS AppSync simplifies application development by letting you create a flexible API to securely access, manipulate, and combine data from one or more data sources. It offers real-time updates and offline data synchronization.
correct: "AWS AppSync" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Connect" is incorrect. It is a cloud contact center service.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Pinpoint" is incorrect. It is for customer engagement and marketing communications.
incorrect.D: "Amazon SNS" is incorrect. It is for pub/sub messaging, not offline sync.

q: A company wants to run a quick assessment to check if their AWS environment follows best practices for security and cost optimization. Which service should they use?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and makes recommendations for saving money, improving system availability and performance, and closing security gaps.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS CloudTrail" is incorrect. It records API calls.
incorrect.C: "AWS Config" is incorrect. It records resource configurations.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Inspector" is incorrect. It scans for vulnerabilities.

q: Which pricing model is most cost-effective for an EC2 instance that will be used for a short-term, one-time project that cannot be interrupted?
explanation: On-Demand Instances are best for short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted. There are no upfront costs or long-term contracts.
correct: "On-Demand Instances" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Spot Instances" is incorrect. They can be interrupted.
incorrect.C: "Reserved Instances" is incorrect. They require a 1 or 3-year commitment.
incorrect.D: "Dedicated Hosts" is incorrect. They are more expensive and used for licensing requirements.
