incorrect.C: "Amazon Athena" is incorrect. Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL.
incorrect.D: "Amazon EMR" is incorrect. Amazon EMR is the industry-leading cloud big data platform for processing vast amounts of data using open source tools such as Apache Spark, Apache Hive, Apache HBase, Apache Flink, Apache Hudi, and Presto.

q: Which AWS service allows you to create and manage your own machine learning models?
explanation: Amazon SageMaker provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly.
correct: "Amazon SageMaker" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Rekognition" is incorrect. Amazon Rekognition makes it easy to add image and video analysis to your applications.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Polly" is incorrect. Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech, allowing you to create applications that talk, and build entirely new categories of speech-enabled products.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Lex" is incorrect. Amazon Lex is a service for building conversational interfaces into any application using voice and text.

q: Which AWS service helps you to automate the testing of your mobile applications?
explanation: AWS Device Farm is an app testing service that lets you test and interact with your Android, iOS, and web apps on many devices at once, or reproduce issues on a device in real time.
correct: "AWS Device Farm" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Mobile Hub" is incorrect. AWS Mobile Hub was a service to create, build, test, and monitor mobile apps that use AWS services. It has been superseded by AWS Amplify.
incorrect.C: "AWS Amplify" is incorrect. AWS Amplify is a set of tools and services that can be used together or on their own, to help front-end web and mobile developers build scalable full stack applications, powered by AWS.
incorrect.D: "Amazon AppStream 2.0" is incorrect. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed non-persistent application and desktop streaming service.

q: Which AWS service allows you to run applications on edge devices?
explanation: AWS IoT Greengrass seamlessly extends AWS to edge devices so they can act locally on the data they generate, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and durable storage.
correct: "AWS IoT Greengrass" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS IoT Core" is incorrect. AWS IoT Core is a managed cloud service that lets connected devices easily and securely interact with cloud applications and other devices.
incorrect.C: "AWS IoT Analytics" is incorrect. AWS IoT Analytics is a fully managed service that makes it easy to run and operationalize sophisticated analytics on massive volumes of IoT data.
incorrect.D: "AWS IoT Device Management" is incorrect. AWS IoT Device Management makes it easy to securely register, organize, monitor, and remotely manage IoT devices at scale.

q: Which AWS service allows you to analyze and visualize data from your AWS data lake?
explanation: Amazon QuickSight is a scalable, serverless, embeddable, machine learning-powered business intelligence (BI) service built for the cloud.
correct: "Amazon QuickSight" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect. Amazon Redshift is a fast, scalable data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze all your data across your data warehouse and data lake.
incorrect.C: "Amazon EMR" is incorrect. Amazon EMR is the industry-leading cloud big data platform for processing vast amounts of data using open source tools such as Apache Spark, Apache Hive, Apache HBase, Apache Flink, Apache Hudi, and Presto.
incorrect.D: "AWS Glue" is incorrect. AWS Glue is a serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development.

q: Which AWS service allows you to manage SSL/TLS certificates for your applications?
explanation: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) is a service that lets you easily provision, manage, and deploy public and private Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) certificates for use with AWS services and your internal connected resources.
correct: "AWS Certificate Manager" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS IAM" is incorrect. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely.
incorrect.C: "AWS KMS" is incorrect. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) makes it easy for you to create and manage cryptographic keys and control their use across a wide range of AWS services and in your applications.
incorrect.D: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications or APIs against common web exploits and bots that may affect availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.

q: Which AWS service allows you to run code in response to changes in data in an Amazon S3 bucket?
explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You can trigger Lambda from over 200 AWS services and SaaS applications.
correct: "AWS Lambda" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon EC2" is incorrect. Amazon EC2 provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud, but requires you to provision and manage servers.
incorrect.C: "Amazon ECS" is incorrect. Amazon ECS is a highly scalable, fast, container management service.
incorrect.D: "Amazon EKS" is incorrect. Amazon EKS is a managed service that makes it easy for you to run Kubernetes on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes control plane or nodes.

q: Which AWS service helps you to secure your data at rest by encrypting it?
explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) makes it easy for you to create and manage cryptographic keys and control their use across a wide range of AWS services and in your applications.
correct: "AWS KMS" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS WAF" is incorrect. AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications or APIs against common web exploits and bots that may affect availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.
incorrect.C: "AWS Shield" is incorrect. AWS Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service that safeguards applications running on AWS.
incorrect.D: "Amazon GuardDuty" is incorrect. Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior.

q: A new e-commerce company is looking for an AWS service to send transactional emails, such as order confirmations and password resets, to their customers. Which AWS service would be most appropriate for this task?
explanation: Amazon SES is specifically designed to help users send transactional emails, marketing messages, and other types of content to their customers. It provides a reliable and cost-effective way for businesses to communicate with their customer base through emails.
correct: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is incorrect. It is designed for pub/sub messaging, not transactional emails.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. It is a message queue service.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)" is incorrect. It is for compute capacity, not a specialized email service.

q: A corporation with multiple departments each having their own AWS accounts wants to implement a solution to customize billing data to match their specific showback or chargeback business logic. They wish to group accounts with similar financial owners and generate a distinct Cost and Usage Report (CUR) for each group. Which AWS service should they use to meet these requirements?
explanation: AWS Billing Conductor is a customizable billing service that allows the organization to define billing groups, set pricing rules, create custom line items, and generate a unique Cost and Usage Report (CUR) for each billing group.
correct: "AWS Billing Conductor" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Budgets" is incorrect. It sets custom cost and usage budgets but doesn't offer the extensive customization/grouping for CURs.
incorrect.B: "AWS Cost Explorer" is incorrect. It visualizes spend but doesn't create custom billing groups or pricing rules.
incorrect.C: "AWS Billing and Cost Management" is incorrect. It is the general toolset but doesn't offer the specific functionality of Billing Conductor.

q: A newly founded tech startup is looking for a program that offers AWS credits, training, technical support, and other resources to help them build their business. Which AWS program would be the best fit for them?
explanation: AWS Activate for Startups is designed to provide startups with low-cost, easy-to-use infrastructure, credits, training, and support.
correct: "AWS Activate for Startups" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Educate" is incorrect. Targeted at the educational sector.
incorrect.C: "AWS Marketplace" is incorrect. Digital catalog for software.
incorrect.D: "AWS Partner Network" is incorrect. For APN Partners building businesses.

q: A small business owner who is not tech-savvy is looking to find AWS certified experts for a short-term project. They need a service that can help them connect with professionals who can offer advice and help implement AWS solutions quickly. Which AWS service should they use?
explanation: AWS IQ helps customers find AWS certified third-party experts for on-demand help.
correct: "AWS IQ" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Training and Certification" is incorrect. For learning.
incorrect.C: "AWS Support" is incorrect. For technical support, not hiring experts for projects.
incorrect.D: "AWS Marketplace" is incorrect. For buying software.

q: Which AWS service does AWS Snowball Edge natively support?
explanation: You can run Amazon EC2 compute instances hosted on a Snowball Edge device.
correct: "Amazon EC2" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS)" is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)" is incorrect.

q: A cloud practitioner needs to migrate a 70 TB of data from an on-premises data center into the AWS Cloud. The company has a slow and unreliable internet connection. Which AWS service can the cloud practitioner leverage to transfer the data?
explanation: AWS Snowball is a physical device for transferring large amounts of data (up to 80 TB) when internet connectivity is slow or unreliable.
correct: "AWS Snowball" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon S3 Glacier" is incorrect. Archive storage service.
incorrect.C: "AWS Storage Gateway" is incorrect. Hybrid storage over internet/direct connect.
incorrect.D: "AWS DataSync" is incorrect. Uses network for transfer.

q: A company has a global user base and needs to deploy AWS services that can decrease network latency for their users. Which services may assist? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon CloudFront caches content at edge locations to decrease latency. AWS Global Accelerator directs traffic to the nearest endpoint using the AWS global network to decrease latency.
correct: "Amazon CloudFront" and "AWS Global Accelerator" are the correct answers.

incorrect.C: "Application Auto Scaling" is incorrect. Scaling service.
incorrect.D: "AWS Direct Connect" is incorrect. Decreases latency for on-prem to AWS, not global users.

q: Which AWS service is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
explanation: Amazon SNS sends messages to endpoints like SMS and email.
correct: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)" is incorrect. Primarily email.
incorrect.C: "Amazon Simple Workflow Service (Amazon SWF)" is incorrect. Workflows.
incorrect.D: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)" is incorrect. Queuing.

q: An application has highly dynamic usage patterns. Which characteristics of the AWS Cloud make it cost-effective for this type of workload? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Elasticity allows resources to scale with demand. Pay-as-you-go pricing means you only pay for what you use.
correct: "Elasticity" and "Pay-as-you-go pricing" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "High availability" is incorrect.
incorrect.E: "Reliability" is incorrect.

q: Which benefits can a company immediately realize using the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Variable expenses are replaced with capital expenses
options.B: Capital expenses are replaced with variable expenses

explanation: AWS replaces CapEx with variable OpEx and provides increased agility.
correct: "Capital expenses are replaced with variable expenses" and "Increased agility" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Variable expenses are replaced with capital expenses" is incorrect. Opposite is true.
incorrect.C: "User control of physical infrastructure" is incorrect. AWS controls physical infra.
incorrect.E: "No responsibility for security" is incorrect. Shared responsibility.

q: A user has limited knowledge of AWS services, but wants to quickly deploy a scalable Node.js application in an Amazon VPC. Which service should be used to deploy the application?
explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is an easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services. It handles deployment details automatically.
correct: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CloudFormation" is incorrect. Requires infrastructure knowledge.
incorrect.D: "Amazon LightSail" is incorrect. Cannot deploy scalable app into a VPC easily (simplified VPS).

q: Which AWS service or feature allows a company to receive a single monthly AWS bill when using multiple AWS accounts?
explanation: Consolidated billing (in AWS Organizations) combines billing for multiple accounts.
correct: "Consolidated billing" is the correct answer.

incorrect.D: "AWS Cost and Usage report" is incorrect.

q: What can a Cloud Practitioner use the AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator for?

options.A: Generate reports that break down AWS Cloud compute costs by duration, resource, or tags
options.B: Estimate savings when comparing the AWS Cloud to an on-premises environment
options.C: Estimate a monthly bill for the AWS Cloud resources that will be used
options.D: Enable billing alerts to monitor actual AWS costs compared to estimated costs

explanation: TCO calculators estimate cost savings of AWS vs on-premises.
correct: "Estimate savings when comparing the AWS Cloud to an on-premises environment" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Generate reports..." is incorrect. Cost & Usage Report.
incorrect.C: "Estimate a monthly bill..." is incorrect. Pricing Calculator.

q: Which AWS dashboard displays relevant and timely information to help users manage events in progress, and provides proactive notifications to help plan for scheduled activities?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides alerts and remediation guidance relevant to your specific AWS environment.
correct: "AWS Personal Health Dashboard" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Service Health Dashboard" is incorrect. General status.
incorrect.C: "AWS Trusted Advisor dashboard" is incorrect. Best practices.

q: Which AWS service should a Cloud Practitioner use to automate configuration management using Puppet?
explanation: AWS OpsWorks provides managed instances of Chef and Puppet.
correct: "AWS OpsWorks" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Config" is incorrect.

q: Which of the following best describes an Availability Zone in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: One or more physical data centers
options.C: One or more edge locations based around the world
options.D: A subnet for deploying resources into

explanation: An Availability Zone is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity.
correct: "One or more physical data centers" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "A completely isolated geographic location" is incorrect. Describes a Region.
incorrect.C: "One or more edge locations..." is incorrect.

q: A company needs a consistent and dedicated connection between AWS resources and an on-premise system. Which AWS service can fulfil this requirement?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a private, dedicated link to AWS.
correct: "AWS Direct Connect" is the correct answer.

incorrect.B: "AWS Managed VPN" is incorrect. Uses public internet.

q: Which AWS service helps customers meet corporate, contractual, and regulatory compliance requirements for data security by using dedicated hardware appliances within the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS CloudHSM uses dedicated Hardware Security Module (HSM) instances.
correct: "AWS CloudHSM" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)" is incorrect. Shared hardware.

q: Which of the following should be used to improve the security of access to the AWS Management Console? (Select TWO.)
explanation: MFA and strong password policies are key for console access security.
correct: "AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (AWS MFA)" and "Strong password policies" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "AWS Secrets Manager" is incorrect.

q: A user needs an automated security assessment report that will identify unintended network access to Amazon EC2 instances and vulnerabilities on those instances. Which AWS service will provide this assessment report?
explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service for EC2.
correct: "Amazon Inspector" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "EC2 security groups" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS hybrid storage service enables a user's on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS Cloud storage?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway enables hybrid cloud storage.
correct: "AWS Storage Gateway" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Backup" is incorrect.

q: An eCommerce company plans to use the AWS Cloud to quickly deliver new functionality in an iterative manner, minimizing the time to market. Which feature of the AWS Cloud provides this functionality?
explanation: Agility allows you to quickly spin up resources and iterate.
correct: "Agility" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Elasticity" is incorrect.

q: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model should be avoided if a workload cannot accept interruption if capacity becomes temporarily unavailable?
explanation: Spot Instances can be interrupted.
correct: "Spot Instances" is the correct answer.

q: What is the function of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling?

options.A: Scales the size of EC2 instances up or down automatically, based on demand.
options.B: Automatically updates the EC2 pricing model, based on demand.
options.C: Scales the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically, based on demand.
options.D: Automatically modifies the network throughput of EC2 instances, based on demand.

explanation: Auto Scaling adds/removes instances (scales in/out).
correct: "Scales the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically, based on demand." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Scales the size..." is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "Automatically updates the EC2 pricing..." is incorrect.

q: What can a Cloud Practitioner do with the AWS Cost Management tools? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Visualize AWS costs by day, service, and linked AWS account.
options.B: Terminate EC2 instances automatically if budget thresholds are exceeded.
options.C: Automatically modify EC2 instances to use Spot pricing to reduce costs.
options.D: Create budgets and receive notifications if current or forecasted usage exceeds the budgets.
options.E: Archive data to Amazon Glacier if it is not accessed for a configured period of time.

explanation: Visualize costs (Cost Explorer) and Create budgets/notifications (AWS Budgets).
correct: "Visualize AWS costs by day, service, and linked AWS account." and "Create budgets and receive notifications if current or forecasted usage exceeds the budgets." are the correct answers.

incorrect.E: "Archive data to Amazon Glacier..." is incorrect.

q: Which service can a Cloud Practitioner use to configure custom cost and usage limits and enable alerts for when defined thresholds are exceeded?
explanation: AWS Budgets enables custom cost/usage budgets and alerts.
correct: "AWS Budgets" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Consolidated billing" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS-managed service can be used to process vast amounts of data using a hosted Hadoop framework?
explanation: Amazon EMR provides a managed Hadoop framework.
correct: "Amazon EMR" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect.

q: A Cloud Practitioner requires a simple method to identify if unrestricted access to resources has been allowed by security groups. Which service can the Cloud Practitioner use?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks for unrestricted security group access.
correct: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is the correct answer.

q: Which AWS service should a Cloud Practitioner use to establish a secure network connection between an on-premises network and AWS?
explanation: Virtual Private Network (VPN) creates a secure connection.
correct: "Virtual Private Network" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Mobile Hub" is incorrect.

q: A Cloud Practitioner wants to configure the AWS CLI for programmatic access to AWS services. Which credential components are required? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Access Key ID and Secret Access Key are needed for CLI.
correct: "An access key ID" and "A secret access key" are the correct answers.

incorrect.E: "A private key" is incorrect.

q: A company requires a dashboard for reporting when using a business intelligence solution. Which AWS service can a Cloud Practitioner use?
explanation: Amazon QuickSight provides BI dashboards.
correct: "Amazon QuickSight" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon Redshift" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service can be used to perform data extract, transform, and load (ETL) operations so you can prepare data for analytics?
explanation: AWS Glue is an ETL service.
correct: "AWS Glue" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon QuickSight" is incorrect.

q: Which cloud architecture design principle is supported by deploying workloads across multiple Availability Zones?
explanation: Deploying across AZs supports 'Design for failure' (fault tolerance).
correct: "Design for failure." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Automate infrastructure." is incorrect.

q: Which technology can automatically adjust compute capacity as demand for an application increases or decreases?
explanation: Auto Scaling adjusts capacity.
correct: "Auto Scaling" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Load balancing" is incorrect.

q: What should a Cloud Practitioner ensure when designing a highly available architecture on AWS?

options.A: Servers have low-latency and high throughput network connectivity.
options.B: The failure of a single component should not affect the application.
options.C: There are enough servers to run at peak load available at all times.
options.D: A single monolithic application component handles all operations.

explanation: In HA, single failures should not affect the application.
correct: "The failure of a single component should not affect the application." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Servers have low-latency..." is incorrect.

q: A Cloud Practitioner is re-architecting a monolithic application. Which design principles for cloud architecture do AWS recommend? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Implement loose coupling and design for scalability.
correct: "Implement loose coupling." and "Design for scalability." are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Implement manual scalability." is incorrect.

q: A company plan to move the application development to AWS. Which benefits can they achieve when developing and running applications in the AWS Cloud compared to on-premises? (Select TWO.)

options.A: AWS automatically replicates all data globally.
options.B: AWS will fully manage the entire application.
options.C: AWS makes it easy to implement high availability.
options.D: AWS can accommodate large changes in application demand.
options.E: AWS takes care of application security patching.

explanation: High availability and handling large demand changes are key benefits.
correct: "AWS makes it easy to implement high availability." and "AWS can accommodate large changes in application demand." are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "AWS automatically replicates all data globally." is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "AWS will fully manage the entire application." is incorrect.
incorrect.E: "AWS takes care of application security patching." is incorrect.

q: Which of the following is an advantage for a company running workloads in the AWS Cloud vs on-premises? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Less staff time is required to launch new workloads.
options.B: Increased time to market for new application features.
options.C: Higher acquisition costs to support elastic workloads.
options.D: Lower overall utilization of server and storage systems.
options.E: Increased productivity for application development teams.

explanation: Less staff time for launch and increased productivity.
correct: "Less staff time is required to launch new workloads." and "Increased productivity for application development teams." are the correct answers.

q: Which AWS services offer compute capabilities? (Select TWO.)
explanation: ECS and Lambda are compute services.
correct: "Amazon ECS" and "AWS Lambda" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Amazon DynamoDB" is incorrect.

q: Which benefit of AWS enables companies to replace upfront fixed expenses with variable expenses when using on-demand technology services?
explanation: Pay-as-you-go pricing replaces fixed expense with variable expense.
correct: "Pay-as-you-go pricing" is the correct answer.

q: Which of the following tasks can a user perform to optimize Amazon EC2 costs? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Implement Auto Scaling groups to add and remove instances based on demand.
options.B: Create a policy to restrict IAM users from accessing the Amazon EC2 console.
options.C: Set a budget to limit spending on Amazon EC2 instances using AWS Budgets.
options.E: Create users in a single Region to reduce the spread of EC2 instances globally.

explanation: Auto Scaling and Reserved Instances optimize costs.
correct: "Implement Auto Scaling groups to add and remove instances based on demand." and "Purchase Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances." are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Create a policy to restrict IAM users..." is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "Set a budget to limit spending..." is incorrect. Budgets alert, don't limit.
incorrect.E: "Create users in a single Region..." is incorrect.

q: Which on-premises costs must be included in a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) calculation when comparing against the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO.)

options.C: Network infrastructure in the data center

explanation: Physical hardware and network infrastructure costs are eliminated in cloud, so must be included in comparison.
correct: "Physical compute hardware" and "Network infrastructure in the data center" are the correct answers.

incorrect.B: "Operating system administration" is incorrect. Still needed in cloud (IaaS).
incorrect.E: "Database schema development" is incorrect.

q: AWS are able to continue to reduce their pricing due to:
explanation: Economies of scale allow AWS to reduce prices.
correct: "Economies of scale" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Pay-as-you go pricing" is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service is a fully-managed source control service that hosts secure Git-based repositories?
explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a source control service.
correct: "AWS CodeCommit" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS CodeBuild" is incorrect.

q: Service control policies (SCPs) manage permissions for which of the following?
explanation: SCPs are used with AWS Organizations.
correct: "AWS Organizations" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Global Infrastructure" is incorrect.

q: Which of the following can be used to identify a specific user who terminated an Amazon RDS DB instance?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs API calls, identifying users.
correct: "AWS CloudTrail" is the correct answer.

q: Which of the following are valid best practices for using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service? (Select TWO.)

options.A: Embed access keys in application code.
options.C: Use inline policies instead of customer managed policies.
options.D: Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users.
options.E: Grant maximum privileges to IAM users.

explanation: Create individual users and use groups for permissions.
correct: "Create individual IAM users." and "Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users." are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "Embed access keys..." is incorrect.
incorrect.E: "Grant maximum privileges..." is incorrect.

q: A Cloud Practitioner noticed that IP addresses that are owned by AWS are being used to attempt to flood ports on some of the company's systems. To whom should the issue be reported?
explanation: Report abuse to the AWS Trust & Safety team.
correct: "AWS Trust & Safety team" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Professional Services" is incorrect.

q: What can be used to allow an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance to securely store data in an Amazon S3 bucket without using long-term credentials?
explanation: IAM Roles provide temporary credentials.
correct: "AWS IAM role" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "AWS Systems Manager" is incorrect.

q: According to the shared responsibility model, which security-related task is the responsibility of the customer?

options.B: Securing servers and racks at AWS data centers.
options.C: Maintaining firewall configurations at a hardware level.

explanation: Encryption is a customer responsibility.
correct: "Maintaining server-side encryption." is the correct answer.

q: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility?

options.A: Maintaining the infrastructure needed to run Amazon DynamoDB.
options.B: Updating the operating system of AWS Lambda instances.
options.D: Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances.

explanation: Guest OS updates on EC2 are customer responsibility.
correct: "Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances." is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Maintaining the infrastructure... DynamoDB" is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "Updating the operating system... Lambda" is incorrect.

q: According to the shared responsibility mode, which security and compliance task is AWS responsible for?

options.A: Granting permissions to users and services

explanation: Updating host firmware is AWS responsibility.
correct: "Updating Amazon EC2 host firmware" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Granting permissions..." is incorrect.

q: Which AWS service can be used to load data from Amazon S3, transform it, and move it to another destination?
explanation: AWS Glue is an ETL service.
correct: "AWS Glue" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Amazon RedShift" is incorrect.

q: How should an organization deploy an application running on multiple EC2 instances to ensure that a power failure does not cause an application outage?

options.A: Launch the EC2 instances in separate regions
options.B: Launch the EC2 instances into different VPCS
options.C: Launch the EC2 instances into different Availability Zones
options.D: Launch the EC2 instances into Edge Locations

explanation: Different AZs provide fault tolerance against power failures.
correct: "Launch the EC2 instances into different Availability Zones" is the correct answer.

incorrect.A: "Launch the EC2 instances in separate regions" is incorrect.
incorrect.B: "Launch the EC2 instances into different VPCS" is incorrect.
incorrect.D: "Launch the EC2 instances into Edge Locations" is incorrect.

q: Which of the statements below is correct in relation to Consolidated Billing? (Select TWO.)

options.A: You receive one bill per AWS account
options.B: You receive a single bill for multiple accounts
options.C: You pay a fee per linked account
options.D: You can combine usage and share volume pricing discounts
options.E: You are charged a fee per user

explanation: Single bill and volume discounts.
correct: "You receive a single bill for multiple accounts" and "You can combine usage and share volume pricing discounts" are the correct answers.

incorrect.A: "You receive one bill per AWS account" is incorrect.
incorrect.C: "You pay a fee per linked account" is incorrect.
incorrect.E: "You are charged a fee per user" is incorrect.

q: Amazon S3 is typically used for which of the following use cases? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Static websites and media hosting.
correct: "Host a static website" and "Media hosting" are the correct answers.

incorrect.E: "Message queue" is incorrect.

q: Which of the following statements are security principles within the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO.)
